The room was very well appointed, spacious (probably b/c the double beds were full size instead of queen), with flat screen TV (which we didn't turn on with the exception when the maid turn it on for music during turndown--nice ambiance touch upon our return to our room.), water pressure was excellent---almost felt like getting a good massage which my girlfriend agreed), clean (most important to us), and simply decorated. We never once saw another guest on our floor which was nice and quiet. The noise level can be high from passerby in the gas lamp district. It didn't bother us as it just sound like white noise. However, it you have a lower level room, I can see that it might be disturbing. The facility charge included water bottles, wifi, and usage of the fitness center( which we used on one morning only--nice & standard). For a weekend pleasure trip where you have no need for the business center & wi-fi, the additional fee may add up. However, for the business traveler, it's convenient and an acceptable fee. In terms of location, it's very conveniently located. You can hop across the street and shop til you drop at Horton PLaza where there are plenty of eateries, movie theatre, CVS etc... You are only foot steps to the Gas Lamp Quarters, too. Valet service was very efficient---I usually telephone the reception desk for our car---and each time we arrived at the garage, our car was there waiting for us. It's definitely worth the $32. (although management should consider lowering the fee to $25) We had a brief tour of the Sunday Brunch and didn't have time to partake. However, we would love to come back to experience Sunday brunch in the future. It looked absolutely devine with everything plated so exquisitely. The chocolate fountain would be a sight of heaven for my 5 yo chocoholic daughter if she was there. Overall, we had a wonderful stay at the Westgate. It's not the Four Seasons Lanai' (where we were greeted daily by all staff by our surname) by any means but satisfactory for Downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but rather expensive”
Reviews.Author: aspataro
Reviews.Content: So my wife and I took a trip to San Diego for Memorial Day weekend. I booked the hotel through Pricelind and got a good rate. Upon checking into the hotel though I forgot to account for overnight valet parking ($30 per night). Which I thought was ridiculous as they should offer hotel guests a discounted rate. They also charged a $15 per night facility fee, which includes wifi internet, and fitness room access. Having the wifi was fine but why the heck do you need to workout in San Diego on vacation is beyond me. Anyway, our room was nice and the service was okay. We kept on getting walked in on by the staff as they were confused about the "do not disturb" sign. Everything else was fine. My overall impression is that if you plan on using Priceline don't expect too much savings when your staying in downtown San Diego because parking is always going to be expensive. I would say that for the amount ofoney you end up paying, you're better off with a three star hotel or even perhaps staying in La Jolla. Afterall, we spent most of our time on the beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, but ridiculous with their hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: Angela_Di
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Westgate just recently for a work conference. I loved the ambiance, and the decor. It had a French Versailles feel-to-it which I love. My room was clean, the bathroom was a decent size. My main dislike about this hotel were the hidden charges, I was charged $32 for parking and an additional $25 daily charges which in my opinion should have been included in the room rate. But this is not as bad as the next thing. I find it comical how I was charged almost $10 for a two minute phone call made from my room to my husband's cell phone. When we first checked in the concierge had stated that we could make out-of-state phone calls for free, then next thing we find out I was charged $10 for a 2 minute phone call. Utterly ridiculous! I told front desk that this is misleading and they should put a disclaimer by the phone saying that customers will be charged 300% more if they decide to use the hotel phone. Very misleading! Another thing I disliked about the hotel was the lack of a pool and hot tub. Also the breakfast and lunch provided for the conference by the hotel was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic "Classic" hotel? Something different in today's modern world.”
Reviews.Author: Sbsdevil
Reviews.Content: First of all, I travel quite a bit for work so I am accustomed to the modern business class hotels. While most are very nice, they are all about he same once you get in your room. This is where is the Westgate differs from other hotels. The rooms are huge and decorated as they would have been 50 years ago. There is also a huge step out balcony, letting you enjoy the fantastic San Diego weather. Hate the Lack of shower pressure in today's hotels? Well, You will not have that problem at the Westgate. There were also a ton of power outlets in the room. A rarity these days. They only complaint is the 15 dollar fee they charge every guest. They should be more upfront about this fee and not surprise you with it at check-in. Internet access was included in that fee and thankfully the speeds and performance were great. You can beat the location of this hotel it is in the middle of everything. I was able to get an amazing prove though an online travel site. For the price, this hotel was a steal.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE HOTEL TO STAY AT”
Reviews.Author: coreyakira
Reviews.Content: went out for my birthday and brought people back to the room. guest complained about the noise-so we turned down the music and tv. 2mins later got called about a noise complaint. Then I kicked everyone out of the room except for my girlfriend. Then we were talking to each other in the room and we were forced to leave the hotel because we were "talking to loud"-just me and her having a conversation...WTF!!!! cant even talk to the person you love??? So at 4am we were heavily intoxicated and forced to pay $295.26(room+valet+fees)and drive away from the hotel drunk, so i spent my birthday in a car on the street. I dont recommend this hotel for people who stay up after 12am and like to have fun while vacationing in San Diego. The hotel looks like a haunted house that my grandmother would sleep in-literally looks like a museum. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: desertfairy
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Westgate on Thursday, May 26. I can't even begin to tell you how wonderful the staff was. They were pleasant and professional the entire stay. My husband forgot 2 sets of keys and a pair of sunglasses in the safe and we were contacted immediately. The rooms are large, clean and very comfortable. We also ate breakfast downstairs and had the BEST pancakes ever. I will definitely be staying here again and if I'm in the are for just the day, will stop off for their pancakes. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: SDblondie
Reviews.Content: the hotel felt a little closed in to me once you got upstairs into the hallway, but the rooms are pretty nice. they're big and the bed was comfortable. the bathroom was a little weird, there's no fan or vent so it gets very steamy with the shower on. the location can't be beat. it's near to a million bars, restaurants, shopping and the civic center. i don't think they have a pool but they did have wifi (for an extra $15 which they charge everyone even if you don't use it) and water bottles are included.

Reviews.Title: “A bit older, but that gives you a large room.”
Reviews.Author: ms883
Reviews.Content: The Westgate is showing a tiny bit of age. She may be older than some hotels, but that means rooms are larger (ours was huge by most hotel standards). We had a desk, 2 club chairs, foot stool, armoire with TV, DVD play, safe, and mini fridge. along with assorted side tables and a foot bench. The bathroom consisted of 2 rooms, a dressing room with dressing table, single sink, cabinet with drawers. There was also a WC with a large walk in shower and toilet. The clock radio has an ipod /iphone charging dock. There is no-brainer-to-connect WI-FI (yes, for $15/day as noted by others). The room entrance is a bit odd. Two rooms are accessed from the hallway. You open the hallway door and enter a small hall. We were in room 694. Rooms 694 and 695 enter from then main hallway into this short entry room. From there, you enter your room. It is very private, but initially confusing. This would be a great feature for traveling groups or families. For just my husband and myself, it was unusual. The hotel also uses a magnetic key (yes, an actual key) system (no numbers on the keys) These keys are easily reprogrammed, but I prefer the credit card type of key. I am afraid that if I lost this key it will cost me $120.00 to replace as that is what a locksmith would charge for a replacement key. Arriving at the hotel was disappointing. A group had booked the lobby (that’s right, the lobby) for a fashion show. We were told to enter through the side entrance. That was insulting. I do not like being relegated to a side door. That also means we missed the experience of walking into the impressive lobby. We went to Mexico to purchase insulin that needs refrigeration. The mini fridge in the armoire wasn’t able to keep things cool. The hotel gladly brought a mini fridge to our room and set it up in the dressing room. Thank you for that consideration. The yellow crushed velvet and green and French décor are not would I would have in my home. But, it works for a weekend get away in a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of fees!”
Reviews.Author: angela422
Reviews.Content: I was charged almost $100 of taxes and fees (parking, facilities, room upgrade to double bed, etc). Even though I got the room at a low price on PL, with the additional $100 of fees, we could have stayed at a much better place. The hotel doesn't seem to welcome customers if they were booked from Priceline. They put us on 4th floor, and the rooms were dark and dated. We could hear the street noise throughout the night. There are many hotels out there, stay away from this one...

Reviews.Title: “Westgate”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaTee63
Reviews.Content: Agree with the other reviewer. The hidden $15.00 a day fee for "complimentary internet, 2 bottles of water and a newspaper" could not be opted out of. How is this "complimentary"? Check in was fast and friendly and my daughter and I were given a room with two beds at no extra charge, so that was a positive. The lobby is breath taking and quite pretty, and our room was very clean. Conveniently located to Horton Plaza and the Gaslamp District.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel felt old!”
Reviews.Author: jckdaniels03
Reviews.Content: Got the hotel from Hotwire so we didn't know the exact hotel before booking. Valet fee is $32 overnight and they charge a mandatory $15 fee for Internet, coffee, and newspaper. We used none. Hotel was very formal but felt old and tired. The room was actually very large and the bathroom was spacious. If I had paid the going rate online ($179+) and the $48 total for valet/Internet it would have been more disappointing. But we paid $110 so that made it feel better. For the money, find a newer hotel downtown like the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Supremely elegant hotel - hidden fees and charges though, parking”
Reviews.Author: jwl2672
Reviews.Content: Pros first, cons last. We booked this hotel through Priceline for a spectacularly low price relative to what Expedia was asking (approx. 1/3). When we got there, we were quickly checked in and experienced nothing but positive and friendly service. The hotel lobby is old world, gilded and worthy of a movie set. My fiance and I took engagement photos in the lobby and the second floor ballrooms and hallways. I would not be exaggerating by stating that the hallways on the second floor look palatial, with china cabinets and porcelain statues and vases on pedestals. Our rooms were very well appointed, although the carpets are a bit dated. Nonetheless, everything was very clean and daily maid service was perfect. Messages were left for us when we had our "privacy" sign out, turn down service included filling the ice bucket, it couldn't have been more perfect. We heard the next door neighbors literally and figuratively "banging" but otherwise very well insulated from room and street noise. There is a small, but well-appointed gym, but no pool. The location is excellent. Less than 2 miles from the airport and right next to the Horton mall one block away. 7-eleven next door as well for snacks and drinks. One issue though, San Diego downtown is a bit sketchy - there are a lot of homeless and bail bonds places right around the corner from 4-5 star hotels like this and the US Grant. We asked the concierge if walking to Little Italy was possible (at 10 pm) and she cheerfully said yes. After 3 blocks, we had to turn back and get the car. The streets became rough and dark with underpasses and highway crossings. I wouldn't do it and she shouldn't have given us the advice. Now for the bad part - and this is big. Parking now costs $32 per day! And there is no street parking at all in the area (for over 30 minutes). Much of San Diego downtown is like this so you have no choice but to pay. Next, there is now a Mandatory, HIDDEN $15 room fee! This is over and above your Priceline total. So if you think all you're paying is the Priceline total, you are WRONG! Add $15 to it. The attendant told us that this was a new policy and that it covered wireless internet, 2 bottles of water a day, and a newspaper. We could not opt out of it. This is flat out wrong. People use priceline in order to pre-pay and get a total and fixed cost. What's to stop a hotel from charging $50 extra per night when you show up??? Even if you book this hotel directly from their website, you may miss this extra $15 charge. Al in all, I tolerated the extra fee and parking charges because the hotel was exquisitely elegant. Plus, we had great service and beautiful engagement photos. If I had paid full price, the ratings would have dipped.

Reviews.Title: “What a delight!”
Reviews.Author: Gsedan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Expedia and while I had some trepidation, they were fortunately overcome by "she who must be obeyed". The hotel staff was friendly and could not do more to help direct us, or to answer any questions. The lobby is large, full of the scent of fresh cut flowers, and provides several areas that can be used for visiting and discreet conversation. The valet service is the 1st that I have ever encountered that I would have used for my private car-bright clean underground facility that allows drop off and pick-up in a friendly, unhurried environment. The room was clean and well appointed with a flat screen TV and very comfortable beds. The bathroom with its seperate toilet and bath area was ideal. I would sugest that the Westgate is an adult's hotel. I am sure that children are welcome, and there were several at the hotel when we were there, but the ambiance in the lobby with beautiful music playing and the early French decore throughout might not be the ideal place for young people. We enjoyed the bar and the evening live music, I was happy and amazed that they had a whisky that, I had never even heard of, a wonderful Japanese single malt, but they went well out of their way to locate it elsewhere when I lamented the less than steller single malts at the bar. Looking forward to a return stay at the Westgate.

Reviews.Title: “Would-Be Disaster Fixed By Staff!”
Reviews.Author: damonandtina
Reviews.Content: I had some very polarizing thoughts about this hotel after my recent stay. There was good, there was horrible, and there was the cavalry! First the good: -Beautiful and very large rooms with ornate decor, bathroom fixtures and architecture. -Free wi-fi (a pleasant surprise for a full-service hotel) -Very good, albeit over-priced restaurant and bar. -Gorgeous lobby area and friendly staff. -Mini-balconies on all rooms, with good tv's and air-conditioners -Starbucks coffee complimentary, plus free bottled water, turndown service and mints each night. -Excellent central location near Horton Plaza and about 6 blocks from the harbor. -Lovely and private 3rd floor sun terrace available to all guests, complete with decorative fountains, tables and chaise lounges. Now, the BAD!!! -Over-priced parking (about $30 nightly) -No coffee-maker in room (free coffee is in lounge) -Mini-safe has to be purchased to be used. -2nd night of my 3-night stay was completely sleepless and scary, as a group of completely drunk "soccer riot" types blasted into their rooms next to us screaming at 11 pm, then left. They then returned in the midst of a FORTY MINUTE free-for-all physical fight at 3 a.m. People being thrown against walls, language that would make Bobby Knight blush and apologize,...you get the idea!! I was actually too scared to call for help, as I thought they'd figure out it was me that called and be waiting to beat me up in the hallway, NO JOKE!!! THE CAVALRY!!! -The Westgate earned my complete and total respect the next morning. After apologizing profusely, they assured me that something would be done to rectify the situation for my daughter and me. Later that afternoon, they bumped us to a top floor, SPECTACULAR suite!! Gorgeous harbor views, etc. Further, they gave us 2 free unlimited room service breakfasts (priced at about $25 EACH), moved our luggage for us,....and fined the losers in the room next to us $250 for the disturbance and damage done to the room by smoking in it!! (haha idiots!!). I probably received 7 or 8 very sincere apologies, when only 1 or 2 were necessary. It made me think I really mattered to them and that the staff truly cared about the hotel's reputation and the public perception such an event could stain. Out of a terrible situation, I give them a hearty and heartfelt thumbs-up for the way they made things right. This hotel isn't for everybody, as it's a tiny bit pretentious (the facility, NOT the people) and has no pool for kids. However, it's a place I'd enthusiastically stay again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Prehaps the best hotel I have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: bart_1963
Reviews.Content: Booked The Westgate via Priceline, got a very good price and wasn't sure what to expect for well under $100/night. Have seen some bad reviews of the hotel here. Arrived in San Diego at the conclusion of a 10 day cruise, debarked from the shop very early. I didn't expect my room to be ready but went to the hotel anyway (can't walk around town with luggage). Met by a bell hop who took my luggage to the front desk. They checked and discovered not to my surprise that they didn't have mt room available, the very pleasant woman on the front desk suggest I leave my luggage, and call back around lunch time and they should be able to get me in. I left my luggage and walked back downtown looking for something to do, I decided to take a hop on, hop off style city tour, purchased tickets for that, as well as the zoo and Midway. Spent the day exploring, returned to the hotel at about 3ish, again very pleasant front desk staff. Given my room key, and offered help to get my luggage to my room. From the exterior the hotel is like any other, but once you walk in, you are transported to another time and place, it is one of the most beautiful lobbies I have encountered in a long time. There are ample elevators resulting in Little waiting to get to or from your room. My room was on the 5th floor, it was very nice. Once off the elevator, you are greeted by a set of double doors that lead to two rooms, one of which was mine. An electronic key grants access to the hallway and your room. My room was very large, a french balcony offered a somewhat limited view of downtown. The room was well equipped with TV (older tube type, not a flat screen) DVD player, clock radio with ipod dock, desk, chair and bed. It also had at least 3 phones, one next to the bed on a night table, a second on the desk and a third next to the sink. The hotel offer free wifi access as well. Off the main bedroom was a large bathroom area containing a lengthy vanity, and sink along with nice bath products, creams, shampoos and soap. Off of that room was a walk in closet, with double doors, and a sliding door led to an inner bathroom with toilet facilities and a large shower/bath combination. The room was very clean, but slightly dated by worn carpet. The room was cleaned in the morning, and in the evening there was a turn-down service, where the comfort and extra pillows were stored, chocolate left on the pillow, and a personalized forecast was left on the night stand, free bottle water and ice was also supplied at this time. The hotel made me feel special, I had planned to attend high tea, but didn't feel that my attire suited the occasion, young women were there in the bright colourful dresses and flowery hats. The hotel is very classy. As I had already mentioned the carpet was worn, the only other downside was street noise. San Diego has a busy railway downtown and the noise can be disturbing. As in many big cities, sirens can be heard much of the night, a fire station is just a little over a block away. Also there was a protest one morning across the street that woke me. THe rooms are not well insulated for sound from the outside, but given the quality of this hotel, these are minor issues.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of $20 charge per night for rooms with 2 beds”
Reviews.Author: himong
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my mom and booked a room through Priceline.com. Upon check-in we asked to have a room with 2 beds instead of one with a King bed. The front desk refused unless we paid a $20/day surcharge. In all of the hotels I've stayed before (all 4 stars and above, most through priceline.com for domestic hotels), I've always been able to ask for rooms with either a bed or two beds depending on needs without additional charge. Why is Westgate trying to nickel and dime its customers?

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: jondoll
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a business trip to SD for a Sat night, and we decided to try priceline so we could get a nice hotel at a discount price. We were very pleased when we got a room at the Westgate! However, after we parked our car at the valet and made our way to checkin, we were informed that we did not, in fact, have a room at the Westgate. Despite reserving over a month in advance, our room had been 'overbooked.' They had arranged a room for us nearby at the Westin (which they said is the same star rating as the Westgate, and by the way, they have a pool and jacuzzi which is more than the Westgate has to offer, so we should be happy for the change!), and they were happy to have a bellman walk our bags over if we wanted to leave our car at the Westgate (and pay full price parking for leaving it there). I asked to speak to the manager who said that there was a problem with the way they had received bookings from Priceline, so it was not their fault. I could be assured that this had happened only once in the past 1.5 years, and that it would not happen again. I asked if there was anything they could do for me, but she only reiterated that it was not the hotel's fault that we could not have the room we had been promised, and that, again, the Westin was better given the pool that they have, and apparently we should be happy for the change. Needless to say, we were very disappointed. We had a guaranteed reservation which was not honored, and in spite of multiple inquiries for any semblance of compensation, we got nothing other than the offer to leave our car at the hotel that kicked us out. We would have appreciated at least a waiver for parking, or a discount on our next stay, but no. In spite of asking multiple times, the message was, basically, leave. In short, if you stay at the Westgate, hopefully you pay a lot for your room, otherwise be prepared to be treated like yesterday's garbage.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful under rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexanderten
Reviews.Content: I loved the Westgate. My room was beautiful and spacious, the staff was very helpful, and the location could not be beat. I was on the 22nd floor and it was very quiet. I was attending a conference at the San Diego Convention Center. I took a short cab ride to the convention center but walked to the Gaslamp District a few blocks away. Maid service comes twice a day and I was asked multiple times if I needed anything by doormen and front desk staff. I would absolutely stay here again on business or vacation. I know some people commented about the decor of the hotel but geez you are not living there! I prefer modern myself but I can appreciate what they have done.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel-Should Be a 5 Star!!”
Reviews.Author: Chinana
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the beautiful lobby with its crystal chandeliers, exquisite fresh flowers, and parquet flooring, the lovely aroma of fresh roses permeates the air around you and you know this is likely to be a special stay. We loved how each two rooms lead off from small foyers along the elegant hallways, thereby creating a sense of additional privacy and quiet. Our room was very large with a comfy king bed, two brocaded louge chairs, a nice desk and a very large window with lots of light. The dressing room and bath were equally luxurious with ample mirrors, amenities, and a roomy tub/shower combo. Additional perks were the free Wifi throughout and complimentary morning coffee in the Plaza Bar downstairs, both much appreciated. A nightly turn down service refreshes the room and leaves chocolates on your pillow each evening. Our four nights here were flawless, and the staff were all friendly and helpful. The concierge made great restaurant suggestions and the location is right in the heart of everything, just two blocks from the popular Gaslight District. We walked everywhere. This hotel was one of our all time best. It has completely spoiled us. I cannot imagine what those who made negative comments are seeking. If you like noise, loud music, kids running wild, and plasma TVs-then go elsewhere. But if you appreciate quiet, refined elegance and understated luxury, the Westgate can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, avoid the dining room”
Reviews.Author: melaine01
Reviews.Content: A friend & I arrived on a Monday after a day of sightseeing. I got a great deal on Priceline. We were very happy with the hotel, from the valets, to the friendly, fast service at check-in, to the lovely, spacious room. The bathroom was beautiful and had a great shower with very good water pressure. The room was very quiet....we never heard anyone. Night time turndown was nice with chocolates, music playing and ice and water waiting. The beds were okay.....a little hard, but really no complaints. Great area with plenty of restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Our only problem came the next morning. We decided to have breakfast downstairs in the dining room. The menu looked very inviting. We stood at the door of the restaurant for about 5 minutes. No one greeted us. We became a little confused and wondered if we were supposed to seat ourselves. There were only about 5 tables taken by mostly businessmen. Finally, a hostess (I think) came by and wanted to sit us in a dark corner. We pointed to another table for two (not far away) and asked if we could sit there. She hemmed and hawed and muttered that it would take a long time to get another place setting there, but let us sit there anyway. Within minutes, an enterprising waiter scooped a place setting from one of the many empty tables...voila! Crisis averted! And so we sat, and sat, and waited and waited. Ten long minutes later, the hostess came by and asked if we would like coffee. YES! PLEASE! More waiting, waiting..waited for coffee..waited to have our order taken...someone else came in after us and had all their needs taken care of a lot more promptly. We finally decided we had to leave. Things to do & see. When the waiter finally came to take our order, we asked him to just bring us the check for our coffee because we had to leave. He said he was sorry, and disappeared. The (I'm assuming) manager came to our table. His words to us were "You wanted to sit at this table, we let you sit here. What is your problem?" Holy cow. He was argumentative and rude. We tried to explain that we had been waiting for a long time, and another table who came in after us had already been served. Again, he argued with us. At that point, we just got up and left. This is a lovely hotel in a great location.....my advice though is to avoid the hotel dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelRinck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Westgate Hotel to celebrate my wife's birthday in San Diego. We got a great rate and we were very happy with this hotel. We arrived around 5 PM on Saturday night and we weren't able to find any valets in front of the hotel and when we continued up 2nd Ave a little bit we saw a couple well dressed gentlemen sending people away and saw signs that the parking lot was full. Not a great way to arrive but we circled the block a few times and eventually found street parking a few blocks away. The ease of parking leaves a little bit to be desired but when we got back to the hotel we saw that a wedding was scheduled at 5 and there were a lot of people to park so we gave the hotel somewhat of a pass on that but at that point we were a little nervous about our hotel selection. We walked in to the lobby and immediately the room and the chandeliers gave us a flashback of the Hall of Mirrors from our trip to Versailles last year. The setting is very elegant and classy and I liked it but was kind of sad that my mom wasn't with us because she would have LOVED it. It is definitely a unique hotel in that aspect. We were able to check in quickly and when we got to the room I had a little trouble with the key (an actual key, the first I've seen at a hotel in years but with an interesting design) but after a few tries we were able to get in our room which was very generously sized. We were on the 6th floor and had a view towards the Gaslamp district and the bay which we liked. The glass door opens to a small balcony where you can step out and enjoy the weather, which was a perfect 75 degrees the day we were there. We had a king size bed which was very comfortable and the furnishings continued the French theme from the downstairs lobby. The bathroom was very large and had a vanity area, a large mirror that my wife loved, a closet, and a separate shower/toilet area. One of our only complaints about the room is that the drain in the shower was slow and the water tended to back up rather quickly. I guess our only other complaint is that the tube TV could use an update but not that big a deal. The entertainment center had a DVD player which we found rather fortunate since we had just bought a movie and we were able to watch it that night at the hotel. We didn't have any meals at the hotel but we were close enough to walk to Ruth's Chris for dinner and then The Broken Yolk the next morning for brunch. The hotel is in a very centralized location close to a lot of restaurants, bars, and a Westfield Mall. The area can get somewhat sketchy after dark and I wouldn't venture out north of Broadway. There were a few panhandlers asking us for change out in front of a 7-11 next door but it's the type of thing you'll see downtown in any large city. Overall, we had a great weekend at The Westgate Hotel and would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Should BE 3 Stars Only”
Reviews.Author: HassTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel through priceline.com This hotel should be only 3 stars according to Priceline.com it's 4 stars I think 4 stars are way way too much Hotel is clean, decent staff, very old fasion and boring lobby, dead small bar and really old fasion old looking resutrant. I think its a good choice for an elderly couple to stay there

Reviews.Title: “Watch your Credit Card”
Reviews.Author: vagabond_biker
Reviews.Content: Not in the best part of town, view from my room not good. I was there on a weekend night and was awoken by loud partying down on the streets well beyond midnight. My least favorite of the many 4* hotels I've stayed at in San Diego over the years. At check out I was surprised to learn of a $28 parking charge as I did not have a car during my one-night stay. The charge was removed but reinstated to my credit card several days later. Subsequent emails about this have gone unanswered. A mistake in charging me for parking ( and correcting it) I can understand. Charging me again and not responding is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Service More Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: qltyfin
Reviews.Content: Staff provided friendly excellent service. They deliver more than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel- not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: casietripi
Reviews.Content: Pros- great location, friendly staff, small balcony, great rate on priceline Cons- uncomfortable beds, terrible shower, tacky decor, no pool or hot tub

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wabocabo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just a night, so I didn't have an opportunity to take advantage of the beauty of the Hotel, but it was very nice, room was very well decorated and the size of the room was very large. Down pillows and comforter added to the comfort of my stay. I didn't bring my laptop, but they do offer complimentary wii-fi and coffee in the morning. Very nicely decorated and they had a woman playing the harp in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service undermines this hotel positioning itself as European luxury”
Reviews.Author: AirmileAlex
Reviews.Content: Big rooms in an old fashioned style but the worst service Ive experienced in the US - especially surprising given the high cost of this hotel. I was unable to get any attention at breakfast & left when my order was not taken after 25 minute. I asked the concierge to return my call/ arrange something 4 times & they never got back to me. No coffee machine in the room encourages a personal service approach but a 1 hour timescale for a coffee is unbelievable. Room service claimed 20 minutes but was never delivered below 45 minutes. Stuffy ambience. Definitely not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel if you have the money”
Reviews.Author: Monty_RTA
Reviews.Content: The Westgate Hotel is very upscale from the lobby to the rooms. The rooms were large (I had a king sized bed). The bathroom was nice except for the usual hotel issue with the shower head being too low. (I am not tall but I run into to this issue a lot). The hotel is just down the street from the Horton shopping plaza and close to other shops and restaurants. The hotel is also a short (ten minute) walk to the ocean. If you have the money this is a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel, Very Elegant, I always go back!”
Reviews.Author: nbbgirl901
Reviews.Content: When I walked in the first time, when I was a young child, I thought a princess lived there. The staff was excellent, and so was the food. The beds were extremely comfortable.The bathroom was amazing, a seperate bath and shower! Almost impossible for other hotels. I always go back there even though I live in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “The Westgate Hotel provides pure Class in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: lilydelight
Reviews.Content: From the Front Desk, lovely floral arrangements, Lobby Bar, Restaurant and my beautiful Guestroom, there was never the slightest disappointment. Not only that....The Westgate serves a "proper" High Tea! It was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Spoiled”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysGone73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a long weekend in San Diego, and happened upon the Westgate hotel when choosing a place to stay. This is probably the best decision we made during our entire trip. The hotel is perfectly located in downtown, next to the mall and an overwhelming number of restaurants. The hotel also has a great menu itself, the best of which is Sunday brunch (do not miss this!). From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty. The staff was overly helpfull and willing to assist in every way. Our room was magnificient - clean, beautiful, comfortable. There is turn down service each evening, which was very nice to come back to. Not only was the bed turned down, but music was playing in our room and they had refreshed the towels and completed essentially another maids service. We could not have asked for a better location, facility or staff then what we experienced at the Westgate. No wonder it has been rated one of the top hotels in the country - they deserve every award they receive!

Reviews.Title: “San Diego's Elite Hotel & Hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: hjdirks
Reviews.Content: We feel compelled to share with others our lavish hotel experience at the Westgate Hotel. We have had the pleasure to stay at thisextraordinary hotel on several occasions, and choose it to celebrate special events in our lives. Each time we have been pleasantly surprised with the professional staff, the impecable accommodations, and over-the-top service. Most recently, we stayed at the Westgate to celebrate New Year's Eve and New Year's Day. Our suite had a magnificent view of the city skyline and ocean beyond. It was beautifully decorated with a tasteful combination of antique furnishings to provide both comfort and elegance. Needless to say, it provided the perfect location for a memorable evening. We were able to easily walk from the Westgate to the Gaslamp area where we had a wide selection of dining and entertainment options. We completed our holiday stay with brunch at the Westgate. The variety and quality of the food was more than any one person could possibly resist. This facility is definately for the spoiled and well-to-do traveler, as well as an excellent choice for Southern California residents who want a romantic getaway. Sincerely, Dr. & Mrs. H.J. Dirks Email: hjdirks@lajolla-coastal.com

Reviews.Title: “What a luxury hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: cachapin
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Westgate the week prior to Christmas. We were in town visiting my family, and decided to combine that with a romantic getaway. The room was beautiful, and wonderfully clean. Everything about the Westgate exudes subtle European luxury. Large bathroom, comfortable bed, and nightly turn down service, with the classic chocolate. Though I'm originally from San Diego, I lived further north, and didn't spend a lot of time downtown. The staff was very helpful in recommending restaurants and local bars, and there were great places within easy walking distance. Whenever we had to drive somewhere, the valet was always sure to ask us if we needed directions or assistance before we left. This hotel may not be the one for you if you are expecting something trendy, and slightly rude, which seems to be the "cool" hotel now. It is classic, elegant, with a staff that is there to help whenever you need them. I would most definitely come back, and recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great, elegant place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTom_8
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at The Westgate and loved it! Wonderful service and room, but one of the best parts was the location. Just outside the Gas Lamp district and right on a trolley line. Be sure to visit the bar and meet the English bartender (can't remember his name). He will not steer you wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Tacky decor (think wanna-be European castle) but fantastic room!”
Reviews.Author: LesterLou
Reviews.Content: The decor is really, really cheesy. But, ignoring that the rooms are fantastic and my stay was very relaxing. I never heard my neighbors, any other bathrooms' plumbing and even slept soundly with my balcony doors open, enjoying the fresh air. With a nice turn-down service (chocolates!), really comfy bed and ridiculously spacious room and bathroom/ changing area I could not have asked for a better place to unwind from very busy days at the convention center. I only encountered friendly and helpful staff and enjoyed the free coffee in the morning. Also, as a jogger, just 4 minutes down Broadway St and I was at the water!

Reviews.Title: “Amusingly strange, then ridiculous”
Reviews.Author: jeff3545
Reviews.Content: At first it was just odd. Elaborate, over the top French decor, dead lobby bar and peculiarly acting employees wandering around muttering, but no one at the valet stand and no bellmen. Bell captain took my bags out of the cab, and then wandered off before I could finish paying the cabbie. Had to retrieve my bags from the street people who were pretty interested in them. Clean room, nice check in. But, what check in didn't warn me about was the fact that there would be no running water in my room when I awoke, and that "well, that's been a problem before, but I thought they had fixed it." Perhaps my lack of a shower is what made it impossible for any of the seven employees in the restaurant to bring our table (the only occupied table) a cup of coffee, or perhaps it was the fact that they were all talking on their cell phones. I get the feeling these folks don't make their money being a hotel. Must be a backroom card game or something.

Reviews.Title: “A real nice stay in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelled070
Reviews.Content: A fair nightly rate combined with a comfortable room, well kept common areas and a high-level of service made this a great hotel stay. The Westgate has seen better days, but much of what made this a great hotel in the 1970s remains, from the French antiques in the lobby to its central location. Service was friendly and attentive, even the bartender, a Mr. Duncan, served up a pleasing combination of sightseeing advice and good drinks in a pleasant and well-appointed lounge. The bed was comfortable as was the in-room furniture. On the downside the televisions are dated as is the air conditioning system, but the showers are marvelous and the French styling a real pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “I wish all Hotels were this fabulous”
Reviews.Author: the-traveling-gal
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed at the Westgate for a convention in the beginning of October and everything was amazing. The rooms were absolutely beautiful and kept spotlessly clean. the service was impeccable. They were at your beck and call. I have never had the pleasure of a hotel stay as wonderful as this and I have stayed in some top hotels. Everything was done here to ensure the comfort of the guests. We also were using the Governors suite which was amazing, with it's own kitchen, sitting parlor, front entry way and two spectacular bedrooms. The beds were comfortable, the furniture was beautiful...with down filling in the setees and the showers had amazing pressure. The area around there had some homeless, but where in San Diego can you go without running into homeless people. They didn't bother any of us and we didn't bother them. I would stay here again in the future in a heartbeat. Other hotels could learn quite a leson from them. The Westgate is a Grand Hotel that is fit for Royalty...and they treat you as such. What a place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Elegant! Classy! The BEST of the best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessLG
Reviews.Content: This was by far, THE most elegant and classy hotel I have EVER been in! Fit for royality!The attention to design detail was spectacular! The service from every single hotel employee was spot on! The lobby is like a museum, only better! I felt like a princess there! It is the Nordstrom of hotels! I recommend this elegant hotel to EVERYONE! You would be remiss not to stay here at least once in your lifetime! Only wish I could have stayed longer...

Reviews.Title: “OK , NOT GREAT.”
Reviews.Author: BEAUMONTER
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westgate for 3 nights in Oct. I got a relatively cheap convention rate. Staff were helpful and the rooms were nice. The most irritating feature was the absence of a tea/coffee maker in the room. They expected tea/coffee to be ordered via room service. I found that strange. I would call it a good 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “unique one”
Reviews.Author: xiaotug
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unique -- the decoration, the room and the whole hotel. It is worth trying once. The location is also good, the sushi bar on the street next to the hotel is also worth trying

Reviews.Title: “OLD STYLE ELEGANCE”
Reviews.Author: djl79
Reviews.Content: I give this hotel high mark for style elegance and plenty of attention to detail. Decorated in a classy 1920’s French provincial motif, it is a great reminder the old style, elegance and excesses of the wealthy from a segment of society that is seldom seen. Upon entering, patrons are sucked into a massive and yet sparsely furnished lobby area. Suspended from 20+ foot ceiling are at least 6 large chandeliers (the size of a small car) and each is ornately trimmed; all seemingly to leave you wondering what would happen if they were to fall. Overall, the lobby is very impressive, but is more designed to show off the large collection antiques and therefore had more the appearance of a museum. The lack of coziness made it difficult to carry on a conversation with anyone in the lobby. This was because the furniture was so spread out and if there was any activity in the background, the noises echoed and added to the problem. However, a real good hearing aid or maybe a bullhorn could easily solve this problem. There is a nice internet room with two computers a fireplace and a few sofas. Afternoon tea was impressive with plenty of snacks and a touch of elegance (for a price). The staff bent over backwards to help in every way possible and the people at the front desk were especially helpful and had plenty of information. The guest rooms were also decorated on a grand scale - My room had a very comfortable bed and clean linens and a constant supply of fresh towels and a fresh bathrobe on top of it. Nightly turn down service with chocolates on your pillow adds to the experience. A large television, large bed, two chairs and spacious shower made for a room that you could truly spread out in. There is a workout room in the basement, but no swimming pool. The hotel also lacks a gift shop, but within three blocks there is plenty of shopping. If you like ice in your drink, be sure to keep a supply of dollar bills on hand because the only ice machine is somewhere in the kitchen so a member of the staff will have to bring it to your room in exchange for a tip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in down town San Diego”
Reviews.Author: chicagolouis
Reviews.Content: I was at a conference at the Marriot Marina, but stayed at the Westgate. Nice four star hotel with free newspapers, apples, coffee and an internet computer. the lobby and room was very well maintained. the marina was a ten minute walk. Also, you can take the city airport bus to the Westgate for $2.25

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: midgelfc
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through hotwire so got it a reduced rate $354 for 3 night. The hotwire guidelines said this hotel was a 4 star hotel, however I would rate this as a low 3 star. Reason being, although the hotel has an impressive old fashioned lobby, the rooms felt dated and in need of a refurb. The celling paint in the bathroom was peeling and also the carpet looked like it needed replaced. Also there was a door in the corner of or room which connected to a funny corridor about 2ft long which lead to the next room. Although the other door was locked our door wouldn't which left me feeling a bit uneasy at night and anytime we left the room as I wasn't sure if the other room was able to open there's and have access to our room. Another point I didn't like was that although the room had a fridge, it was locked and the front desk had to be contacted to open it. When asked about having it open they were trying desperately to put us off saying that it's because it doesn't cool drinks but just keeps them chilled. We actually had to ask twice to have it open as the first time it wasn't. Also when our room was turned done by room service they failed to notice the empty toilet paper, so we had to contact the front desk to get more. Apart from the mentioned things above the location of the hotel was spot on, right at the gas lamp district and the 2 young girls on the front desk where very helpful when it came to suggestions for places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Top spot in Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Crossbill
Reviews.Content: We had one night here as a base for Seaworld - we got the room at a discount through Priceline. It was a splendid experience. We went out for breakfast to a local cafe which was a bit nicer that what looked like a rather stuffy hotel dining room

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, elegant hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Person2
Reviews.Content: Got a terrific deal for this hotel on Hotwire. Great hotel for a special occasion: much different from the cookie-cutter "modern" W-clone boutique hotels that are so popular now in San Diego. Best location, right across from Horton Plaza; very luxe French royal design. HUGE rooms - we were going to stay in a tiny (but pretty) room in the Hotel Sofia for more money than the deal we got for this on Hotwire. The room was practically like a suite. Not sure the air conditioning is individually controlled in rooms, and would like extra pillows (they were super-thin) but overall loved this stay. On a high floor we couldn't hear traffic, and we had a great northern view of the city toward Balboa Park.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: Katilia
Reviews.Content: Got a good price from tripadvisor. I wasn't expecting a lot but wowie! what a gorgeous hotel! Staff was beyond helpful. Dining facilities were amazing. All very reasonable for such a beautiful hotel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff at the Westgate!”
Reviews.Author: richdog003
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my wife to San Diego for a couple of days for her birthday. The dates of our stay were August 6th and 7th. Even though I made my reservation through Priceline on their 'name your price' feature (meaning I paid quite a bit less than the typical price), the Westgate accomodated my request for staying in a room with a nice view and even upgraded the room at no additional cost. While there is no pool or spa at the Westgate, both my wife and I extremely enjoyed our stay there. The entire hotel had a distinctive european feel, our room was nice and large and the location put us close to the gaslamp for restaurants and to the Horton plaza which is a nice outdoor mall area. Every employee we encountered treated us professionally and kindly. The only knock I could give this hotel was that even though we were on the 15th floor, we could still hear traffic and sirens from the street below. I don't know if this is the case with all hotels located in the downtown gaslamp area, but the noise certainly did not stop us from having a good night of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old world hotel with charming staff!”
Reviews.Author: Arielarafe
Reviews.Content: We (My husband and my little one year old) came to San Diego for a conference and a mini vacation and decided to stay at this hotel recommended by Tripadvisor's contributors for family. They couldn't be more right! The hotel lobby reminds of me of the old world charm with it's antiques, plush carpets and sofas along with pastoral paintings on the wall. The front desk was ready for us the minute we came into the hotel and we were checked in least than 10 minutes. The rooms had two doors to separate the noise from the outside hallway which were perfect for us since our baby is a light sleeper. They had the crib for us that we have asked for along with the small refrigerator for our baby's things. Even though the crib and the refrigerator were a little outdated but it okay to use it. The room size is very generous by any standard and the bathroom were separated into a powder room which was great to maneuver with the little one. Even though some of the amenities were outdated in the room, we were okay with the usage of them. Our room faced the city center and we had a great view of the city at night which we loved. It's close to all the area and most of the attractions are within walking distance if you like walking. The hotel staff were really good at recommending places for us to eat and we absolutely loved The Fish Market. The hotel staff were also really helpful in printing us directions for San Diego Zoo and Old Town. I couldn't ask for anymore for our first trip with our little one year and the only negative comment is the parking which is a little pricey and we just parked our car across the street at the municipal parking. Overall - I would recommend this hotel for parents with young children and will definitely come back again if we were again in San Diego in the future!

Reviews.Title: “A New Experience”
Reviews.Author: Abeyta_CLD
Reviews.Content: With all the times i have been to the Gaslamp area, i had never stayed at the Westgate hotel until this weekend. Finding it was easy and it was conveniently located 1 block from Horton's Plaza and 2 blocks from the Gaslamp. The review options here seem more like that for a restaurant but i am reviewing this as the hotel. The hotel is definitely older and more refined. Elegant and very tastefully decorated. The place was immaculately clean and polished. The staff at the valet were all polite and courteous and efficient. The staff at the front desk very professional. Alexandra checked me in and she was quite quick and efficient. I had asked for a higher floored room than was reserved and she was able to accommodate me with out fuss. The room we were in faced west and from the balcony you could see the bay. At dusk, it was breath taking. The room was spacious and as tastefully decorated as the lobby. There was a sitting chair, a desk with hard wired internet and an armoire with a television and DVD. The bed was large and firm and the pillows fluffy. The clock radio was made for an IPOD. The bathroom was large and clean and the shampoos and soaps were a good quality. Towels were big and fluffy. The floor didn't have an ice-maker and the valet had offered to bring some up for us. The elevators were fast. The bar on the lobby floor was quite small but large enough for a two piece band (that we didn't take the time to listen too). The only drawback to the room was the noise . . . although old and i would assume the walls were thick, there was very little sound proofing when the door was closed (you could see light from the hallway adjoining two rooms). We happened to be in a room where the next door neighbors were partying until 4am and we heard them until they decided to go to bed. Overall, i would definitely stay here again . . . i would just hope for tired and early to bed hall mates.

Reviews.Title: “definitely not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: travoller
Reviews.Content: when we first walked in the room, our expectations were shattered, definitely not a 4 star hotel. we immediately noticed that there is no soap, shampoo etc. , we were told to look for it under the sink by the person on the phone, we looked and it wasn't there so they sent somebody who brought the shampoos, then had to return back after we said there's no soap too. then the airconditioning, it wasn't cooling up, they said they'll send a guy to look at the problem in 5 minutes but then i recieved another call saying it won't be checked right away because that guy is on another job. all this was happening within 15 min of getting into the room, after a gruelling flight! at 930 PM! they eventually transferred us to another room after i gave them an earful. ok, new room, no fridge, it was locked up, and i had to swat a fat fruitfly trying to get to my food before i went to sleep. this is a lousy hotel that gets good reviews, they're probably writing the reviews themselves to entice people. i was booked here by one of those prepaid travel websites, and i didn't know where i was staying until after you pay for the booking, i won't do that again. this hotel should be re-rated. 3 stars at most, and definitely not worth the money i paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Was hesitant about this place, but now It's my new first choice!”
Reviews.Author: holleytaylor
Reviews.Content: This is long review-- I have so much to say about this place! I travel to San Diego 6-8 times a year, and I always stay downtown. I have about 4 or 5 usual haunts that I typically choose from, but this last trip, EVERYTHING was booked. I finally called this place and they had a room. I took it, only knowing that it was on 2nd street (I'd seen the sign from Broadway). After looking at the website I was a little bummed, thinking I was going to hate it. I like hotels with modern styling usually and typically stay at places like the W. This place did not look like my style at all from the photos. I was thinking it would be a musty old grandma type of place. And then I got there. Walking into the lobby is impressive. It's definitely an old European style that comes off horribly unless opulent enough to be glamourous and elegant. This place pulls it off. The staff at the front desk was very nice. The room was the biggest hotel room I've ever stayed in. Big corner tub in the bathroom, HUGE vanity with stool, four comfortable chairs in the room, and wall-to-wall, floor-to-ceiling window with an AMAZING view (I could see the harbor from my room, along with much of the beautiful downtown area). The photos of the rooms you see on the site don't do it justice at all. There's sliding glass doors and a cute little Juliet balcony. It is a bit outdated (I can't remember the last time I've seen a tube television in any of the hotels I frequent) and the furnishings are older, but very well maintained. The location is unbeatable, walking distance to 100s of bars and restaurants, and about a 15 minute walk to the convention center or Petco Park. While I loved the room, the view, and the whole feel of the place, what really set it apart was the service. Every night at 8, (I was usually not in my room) they'd come in for turn down service. When I got back, the bedspread was removed, leaving a pretty white duvet , sheets turned down, chocolates, dressing robe, and a card on the bed with the weather for the next day, ice, free bottled water, and classical music playing...it was heavenly. The room service was friendly, fast and amazing. The big food portions were hot and delicious and in my room 15 minutes after I called, with all the trimmings and a fresh rose. The staff was kind and willing to help at every turn. Downsides: I mentioned the TV already, and the bed was a bit hard. Not an issue for me because I like a firm mattress, but it's far from one of the best I've slept in. There's a lot of street noise (maybe because of the big window?) but it's par for the course downtown. Also, parking is valet only and $28/night, but this is standard for pretty much anywhere you stay in downtown San Diego. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: junglyhh
Reviews.Content: There are nothing bad I can say about it, even for my usual excuse --- location. The in-room wifi is a little bit slow for using skype for international call but not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great location!!”
Reviews.Author: jessicajean88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely goregous! I found The Westgate by chance through Priceline and was not disappointed at all. The decorations are beautiful--old clocks, a desk from the Palace of Versailles, and original Steinway piano--a mini museum! The room was huge-I loved the bathroom vanity area which had a huge mirror and countertop. Upon arriving, there are complimentary bottles of water with an ice bucket already full of ice. Pretty classical music came from the TV. The staff was very friendly. I wished I could have stayed longer! Very close to the Gaslamp district--could definately walk anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Forgotten Hotel Details”
Reviews.Author: BCSInsider
Reviews.Content: This hotel transports you to another time and place. The letterhead in the, elegant bar, comfortable lobby, well appointed business center, and delicous food (and room service) remind you of what hotels used to be.

Reviews.Title: “The finest in San Diego.........”
Reviews.Author: mrpolarbear
Reviews.Content: The Westgate Hotel is elegantly timeless. Maridella and I had our wedding and reception at the Versailles room 25 years ago and everything was flawless. Thanks to Rachel Osgood, Manager of Catering, we were able to celebrate our silver anniversary dinner back in the Versailles room recently, just the two of us in the middle of the entire ballroom with a personal waiter for the entire evening. The hotel upgraded us to a suite and made the silver anniversary a memory forever. The Westgate room is beautiful in the morning and perfect for breakfast after a special dinner the night before. The rooms and suites are as fine as they were 25 years ago. Maridella grew up in San Diego and of all the hotels in San Diego the Westgate Hotel is her favorite.....perfect for weddings, banquets or a long special weekend. This hotel is right out of the old days in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful room/hotel but not so happy with service”
Reviews.Author: jjjbbb
Reviews.Content: Pros - room was large, bed was super comfy, and shower was fantastic and bathroom area outside shower/toilet room was quite large which I like. Oh - and breakfast in the hotel dining room was delicious (not the Sunday brunch which we didn't try) . Concierge was great - found us a rental car last minute ... I had called around directly and couldn't get one. Cons - dropped off by taxi in front of hotel and no one was there - there was an empty luggage cart which we had to use to wheel in our own luggage. Are you kidding me - at a 4 star hotel...after a 14 hour flight plus a train ride. Not happy....neither was the receptionist who seemed generally grumpy and not happy to be there. As mentioned in other posts, hotel parking is a fortune in a city that almost requires a car. It's great that internet access is free but giving with 1 hand and taking away with the other, it's just a wash and no kudos are earned for the free internet access in my book. We were told at check-in (in a highlights of our hotel) that there is twice daily maid service - yet the first night I had to call down at 7pm to ask for the turn down. Also, they were very stingy with towels. I get the green thing - but would it have hurt to leave more than 2 towels in a room for 2 people. The first night there was a 3rd towel on the closet shelf which we used, but when the room was cleaned the next day, only 2 clean towels were left by housekeeping. I would still recommend this hotel but also would go in expecting 4 star premises with 3 star service. My suspicion is that they are trying to "save" money...the problem is, it shows in the service but at least the premises and rooms are lovely.

Reviews.Title: “stuck in the past but alive and well”
Reviews.Author: copan28
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Westgate and it was a stress free stay. The hotel exteriors have a 70s look but the interiors have a European classic luxury look. Everything is a bit old but still well maintained. The room I stayed in was a regular room and it was spacious, clean and does have a luxury feel to it. Unfortunately, things have not been updated for the 21st century and probably will remain the same to preserve the “luxury look”. The TV is still one of those large CRT old models and the telephone is an early 80s model. But none of the aesthetics matter. Since it is an old building, there are not many electric wall sockets in the rooms. Near the desk, there was only one wall socket with at least 5 cords plugged to a power strip. Just to be safe, you might want to unplug some cords to avoid a surge if you want to plug in your notebook computer. The turndown service was uneven, some nights you get chocolates and water and some nights just the bed is done. The location is excellent in terms of access to local transportation [bus routes, trolley line] and to Horton Plaza. However, San Diego does not have a vibrant downtown core so expect to see vagrants and homeless people wandering about at night along Broadway Ave. If you are a single woman traveler or with children, you might want to stay in the Gas Lamp district where there are more restaurants, shops, hotels, condos and just more “regular” citizens.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance in the Gas Lamp”
Reviews.Author: DonnaMc1
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I drove from Phoenix to attend the American Idols concert in San Diego and stayed at the Westgate. We got a deal on Priceline and was not disappointed! We arrived early and left our bags in the lobby. They called us within 15 minutes to tell us our room was ready so we headed back to get situated after the long drive. Our room was gorgeous! Our room attendant fetched us a large wine bucket for the wine we had brought with use and filled it with ice. There were plush robes for us to use (and of course purchase). The hotel is withing walking distance from the Gas Lamp district which was very convenient. When we returned in the evening, our bed was turned down and our robe were on the bed. We loved using the free wi-fi in our room as well. Overall, the Westgate was a wonderful experience and I would definitely recommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Historic and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Brianm99
Reviews.Content: Traveled to San Diego on business and stayed two nights in the hotel. The hotel is a very beautiful and historic hotel in downtown San Diego. The lobby and public spaces are beautiful. As for service, it was up and down. I twisted my ankle badly while in San Diego and they took good care of me by checking in on me and sending ice to my room. Their color printer was out in the business center and they sent me out to get color copies elsewhere and this is how I twisted my ankle in the first place. Then when I limped back in, the same person who sent me out offered to do the color prints in the back office. If they would have offered that in the first place, I may not be in a brace today. The location is not the best. It is a good ways from the gas lamp district and is not in the middle of the action. One thing that surprised me was that they had a huge reception for a company in the lobby which cut-off access to the restaurant and bar. I have rarely seen a hotel have a reception in the middle of the lobby and in their highest traffic area. This was not good considering I could barely walk and had to settle for room service. Bottom line, if historical elegance is your thing than you will love this hotel. If you are more interested in a trendy atmosphere and a good location then you should look elsewhere in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The Best 4-Star Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: JakePilot
Reviews.Content: From the parking attendant to the GM, this place is an example of how proper training can make a guest feel welcome and happy. The location could not be more central in downtown San Diego. Shopping and food are with walking distance. There is a trolly tour stop across the street . Within two hours you will see most of the city and learn where else you want to go later in your visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Experience”
Reviews.Author: bigbirdbc
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel. The service, the decor is first class. It is truly a grand hotel located in downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely worth every penny!!”
Reviews.Author: sassydeeva
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful!! We just returned from the first of two "babymoons" before the birth of our first baby and I can't say enough good things about the room. The room is HUGE. It's easily the 400 square feet they advertise. We had a single king, two arm chairs, a writing desk, plenty of space, a large bathroom and a huge tub. We were on the 9th floor and it has no view but that wasn't an issue at all. The beds are super comfy, and they have down comforters and down pillows. They will bring you "hypo allergenic" pillows at you're request. Plenty of towels, free wireless internet, free bottled water, and an in room dvd player. All great amenities!!! The hotel is VERY quiet. It's one of those things that if you didn't know it was there, you'd never know it was there. This section of downtown is quiet on the weekends because it's near office buildings, and the civic center (unless something is going on at the civic theater, which is right behind the hotel) It's across from Horton Plaza and the gaslamp is 2 tiny blocks away, so it's the perfect distance away. You don't hear the riff raff from the gaslamp, but are close enough to walk there. The trolly station is right behind the hotel, and if something happens, sometimes you can hear it, but it's very very faint and not bothersome in the least. The hotel is located downtown....which means you deal with downtown issues. San Diego is a large urban area with urban area problems. In walking downtown you will encounter homeless populations, and junkies. That's the city, and has nothing to do with the hotel. I would NOT advise staying here with small children unless you are planning on driving in and driving out. I tend to want to shelter my little ones. Parking is under the hotel and so technically unless you go walking, you will never interact with the undesireable aspect of the city. However, it's totally safe (we walked around after dark with no problems) as long as you're aware of your surroundings. Be prepared to pay handsomly for parking, but then again....it's downtown. I've paid handsomly for parking in every downtown that I've ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4 star urban hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyguyAustin
Reviews.Content: The Westgate is a true four star hotel. Doormen, handsome lobby, attentive and friendly front desk staff, and a good restaurant. The rooms are large and well furnished. (My son ranks hotels by the number of telephones, and my room had three.) Each of two adjacent guest rooms has a small private vestibule. Housekeeping was excellent and included nightly turn-down service. Good, though not extensive, set of bathroom amenities. Complementary Starbucks coffee is provided until 9AM in the bar. Wireless Internet is free. This is an urban hotel in the downtown section. The hotel is near Horton plaza, the in-city shopping center. It is a 40 minute walk to Balboa park and the Zoo, and surrounded by a number of restaurants. My only complaint is that you can hear the street noise, and my room overlooked the streetcar…but that is what you get with an urban hotel. This is a first-rate hotel in the traditional style and you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Value for Pre or Post-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: hello1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Lobby and Rooms - Extremely friendly, helpful and informative staff, not one single exception! The Rooms were Huge and Elegant - We felt as though we were in a very upscale European Hotel (Think Paris, France!) We had a Wonderful stay and would most definitely return. Highly recommended and Excellent Value for the Price we paid via a Bid at Price Line. Great Location for a Pre or Post Cruise Stay (Note: Currently, No Free Shuttle Service is available. Taxi for 2 is about $ 12.00 Total Fare from Airport and about $ 10.00 Total Fare to the Cruise Ship Pier) It is an Easy Walk to the USS Midway, Oceanwalk, Gas Lamp District, Horton Plaza, Numerous Restaurants, Trolley Stop (Both City Light Rail and San Diego Trolley Tour) AmTrak Station, etc. There are no Coffee Makers in the Rooms (There is free Coffee available in the Lobby in the Morning) You might want to to visit the small french Bistro one block down for speciality coffees and/or croissants, etc. Depending on the location of your room, there may be a bit of ongoing outside noise that you will hear....Remember, you are in the City !! Quick Last Note: If you are a Family with younger children (and looking for a Kiddie type environment) this may not be the best fit for you - There is no Pool / Play area available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Much better than I expected. Felt is was a screaming bargain!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiOlivier
Reviews.Content: Excellent. And another co-worker was staying at a major flag a block away at almost double the price. My room was larger. The staff was far more attentive. The attention to detail was excellent. Very impressed - to the point that I sought out the manager to express my thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, the staff is excellent”
Reviews.Author: wdharrington
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night this month and I wish I could've stayed longer. Priceline had it for $80, so it was a real steal. The staff was very accomodating with my requests. The rooms are big and the beds very comfortable. The shower is large too. My only gripe would be to have higher sinks, but I'm a taller person. They have free internet which is a plus, especially in a four star hotel where they normally charge. Parking here is expensive and it was a little frustrating to see my car four feet away and not be able to just hop in and leave. I'd stay here again no doubt though.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: AAFltAttendant
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel with spectacular rooms. Styled after the Palace of Versailles in France this is an extraordinarily glamorous hotel rich in history. A real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, old-style hotel”
Reviews.Author: MadTownTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wfie while attending a conference. The hotel is out of an old movie. The lobby is, as one colleague put it, big enough to hold a gala. The staff are great. Very responsive, with good recoimmendations and excellent service. The rooms are fairly good sized. The only oddity is that there is one door from the hall that then enters into a small alcove where there are two doors to two separate rooms. While odd, it has the benefit of making things even quieter than they already were. Our room was directly across from the elevator, but we heard neither the elevator nor other guests. I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “magnificient”
Reviews.Author: bthebarretts
Reviews.Content: beautiful large rooms,great housekeeping and turn down service. wonderful japanese restaurant across street with very low prices! Down side: transit station around corner with many people living on steps. ( quiet though)

Reviews.Title: “Classic, beautiful hotel. Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: biglerh
Reviews.Content: We got a great price through "Name Your Own Price" at priceline.com. This is a beautiful hotel. Overall the hotel has a classic elegance, old, European and luxurious feel. When we walked through the lobby to check-in, there was a harpist playing beautiful music as a handful of people sat at table having afternoon tea. We checked in with no problem. Our room was spotless clean. We loved the square tub. Customer service was excellent. THE NIGHTLY TURNDOWN SERVICE WAS WONDERFUL! The only cons were 1. No pool (just know in advance, as some people probably don't care) and 2. Parking was $26 a day. I know that's pretty common for downtown hotels, but again, we just weren't prepared for the extra costs.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room!”
Reviews.Author: Wilma58
Reviews.Content: We won this hotel on a Priceline bid for $70 per night (Friday, Saturday). This hotel is beautiful, on the inside. Even the parking garage (as expensive as it is) is beautiful and clean. As stated by other reviews, the outside of the building is unattractive, however, once you step inside it is a different story. The hotel is beautiful, lobby and common areas. We did not dine here, there are too many places in Gaslamp that are seriously fun. Our room was one of the most comfortable rooms ever. The bed and pillows were comfortable, internet connection reliable (9th floor), shower was awesome, bathroom was huge. We placed ice deliver upon check in, barely got settled and our ice was there. The front desk staff was very helpful (especially the girl originally from Austria) and the other staff we encountered were pleasant. We loved this hotel! It was so comfortable, that we barely left the room. The only enhancement we might suggest is to add a small refrigerator and a microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PK6
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my weekend stay at Westgate. For the $139 per night I paid, it was a bargain. Yes, the rooms will remind you of your grandma's decor, but they're very large and comfortable. My room was very quiet on the 7th floor. I appreciated the free bottles of water and the turndown service with chocolates. The hotel is just a short 3-4 blocks to Gaslamp which I walked alone and felt perfectly safe. The people were helpful at the front desk when I had questions. The $28 per day valet parking charge was a ripoff, but I knew it before I booked. I would stay here again for this price.

Reviews.Title: “The grand dame has seen its day”
Reviews.Author: ascavecreek
Reviews.Content: The grand dame has seen its day and she needs an update. We booked on hotwire and got a killer deal. The location was said to be in the “glasslamp district” but its not. Its on the train tracks in the center of downtown San Diego across the street from Horton Plaza. The hotel looks like an office building and when you walk into the lobby, it feels like it should smell of old lady roses bath salts with classical music coming from the baby grand right inside the doorway. The staff, if you could find someone, was nice but not helpful with recommendations on where to dine, where to park, etc. There was no one on duty we were told when we asked about valet parking and or baggage assistance. The room was big and clean but OLD. Very old glam chintz floral on top of floral on top of floral – reminded us of an old out of date European hotel in a medium size city.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel for a leisurely visit to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ballymoneykaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westgate after getting a supurb rate on hotwire. Hotel is located with easy distance to the Gaslamp quarter's many restaurants and bars. Shopping is convenient with HBorton Plaza on your doorstep. A seven eleven is two minutes away to stock up on drinks and snacks. There is a bus stop outside the hotel which we used to transport us to and from the zoo and Coronado. Check in was a breeze and receptionist was extremely helpful. Room was large and offered excellent views of the city from a very wide but narrow balcony. The room's desk was placed in fronmt of the panoramic window. Bed was comfortable and bathroom was clean and refined. Had just stayed in the Venetian 5 star in Vegas - this hotel was far superior in terms of refinement and customer service. would highly recommend and would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Milly113
