Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful, classy hotel in a fantastic location. The rooms were huge and very clean. We had a nice bathroom with a separate sink and vanity area. There was a sliding glass door that allows you to squeeze out onto a very small balcony, but we had a great view of the Coronado bridge and downtown. The staff was very nice. They let us check in hours early with no problems. There is only valet parking at $28 a night (with in and out privileges), however they let us go to a late breakfast for a few hours the morning we checked out and did not charge us for a second day of valet. The hotel is right in downtown- a block away from Horton Plaza and a few blocks away from tons of restaurants and stores. Inside the lobby are huge chandeliers, a piano, and a nice sitting area. The hotel has a high tea for $28-$32 in the lobby (make reservations) and a restaurant on site. It has a small fitness room, but does not have a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star”
Reviews.Author: SFVguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and clean, but for me not a top-notch property. It's like staying at a Wyndham or similar hotel. It would be nice to have a coffeemaker in the room and a fridge would be nice. There is a mini-bar, but you have to call room-service to unlock it. I would like to have a place to keep a chilled bottle of wine or soda. My other beef is with the valet. The hotel's lot fills up and can't accommodate all the guests' vehicles. I took my car out in the evening and asked the valet if I would have any problem when I came back later in the evening and he said "you shouldn't." Well I know I shouldn't, but when I returned at midnight the valets were gone and the lot was full. I found an employee to take my car, but he was looking around like he was looking for a place to park it on the street. Not acceptable when you're paying $28 per day just to park your car. The hotel is right across from Horton Plaza, so shopping and restaurants are nearby. (Don't miss the St. Tropez bakery/cafe across the street for breakfast). Unlike most hotels whose windows only open a crack, all the rooms have sliding glass doors that open, which is great to get the fresh air. But overall its published rates are outrageously high for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: Mantraveler
Reviews.Content: The only thing that stops me giving this one 5* is that they only have valet parking (ie. no self park) and they charge $28 per day which I think is highway robbery. Apart from that, this hotel is simply lovely. Beautifully maintained, excellent service, huge rooms, and fantastic location in the heart of San Diego, one block from the restaurant precinct, and right in front of the Westfield (which I think is a crappy mall, but apparently it's the best in SD). I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Classy”
Reviews.Author: mooney309
Reviews.Content: This hotel reminded me of the Waldorf. Very elegant and European feel. I personally would prefer a hip W type of hotel, but this hotel was still very nice. Nice comfy robes. Large bathroom and sink area. My AC was not working when I first checked in, and someone came to fix it within 30 minutes. Great location as well! Right in the middle of downtown SD and by shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice old fashioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seneschal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights using Priceline ($72/night with help from Biddingfortravel site.). The parking fee is a little steep, but can't beat the convenience. Overall it's an old fashioned hotel, very refined and had nice features (you can you're in a hotel in Paris with the linen and upholstery). The rooms are a little odd sized, fitting the continental Europe model. There's a little too much empty space that is not used. Great views of the San Diego bay though and close proximity to all the major sights around Downtown, very convenient. One negative is soundproofing is very poor. There was some type of Mexican night club or music down the street and the music was booming until 1 AM! Fortunately it was quiet after that, although you do hear all of the police sirens in the neighborhood (we stayed in the higher floors too).

Reviews.Title: “May be fancy but a perfect family place”
Reviews.Author: juljayw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend with our 5 year old son and my mother, sister and neice (8). We had two rooms which were on the same floor. We were worried about the service when we called to say we would be late checking in because we were lost. We were offered reassurance that all was being held for us but no offer was forthcomming to help us find our way there. Once we got there the hotel redemed itself with the swift assistance to our rooms. By the time check-in was complete we arrived at our rooms to find the bell man waiting with all of our luggage. He took our key opened both sets of doors and set our luggage into the closet. He pointed out the ammenities and left. Very efficent. The room was wonderful. Very comfortable. We were starved when we arrived and it was almost 11pm but we ordered room service. We were supprised that it arrived in 20 minutes cooked to order. i did not catch the waiters name but he seated us like we were in a resturant. I almost forgot i was in a bathrobe! The food was quite good. The monte christo was tasty with 4 choices of jam and the burger was cooked perfectly. I enjoyed the Free starbucks coffee downstairs in the lounge in the morning. We chose not to have breakfast there but oppted for the Hob Nob Hill Cafe Ask for directions. Wonderful place! the children loved spending time here and we had to drag them away to Sea World. The only thing that would have made it perfect is a pool. We were able to get this amazing place for $85 a night on Priceline. It was an amazing steal. The gracious hospitality and the beautiful suroundings make it a place I would love to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at this well-located, more-than-comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: samsmom1127
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed at the Westgate for four nights in early August. We were in San Diego for a family wedding. Many activities were planned all over the San Diego area. The Westgate, located in downtown on the edge of the Gaslamp District, proved to be a very convenient starting point for all of them. I never had to drive more than 15 minutes to get anywhere. Our room was just beautiful. It was large, really large. I loved the dressing room that was separate from the bath. The shower had a seat, which is always a nice touch. The 2 queen beds were comfortable, the turndown service included two bottles of water and a full ice bucket as well as the usual chocolates on the pillow, the furnishings were well upolstered and plush. We could open our sliders and step out onto a narrow balcony (big enough to stand on but not big enough to accomodate a chair or table) with a lovely view of downtown, with the harbour visible in the distance. I found everything to be very clean. Another poster commented on the interesting "suite-like" configuration wherein there is a main door from the hallway that opens onto a foyer for two rooms across from each other. It certainly helps keep things quiet. Also, there was free, high-speed wireless internet in the room, which is something upon which I am becoming increasingly dependent when I travel. I had no problems with service. Check-in was smooth and we were directed immediately to our room in spite of having arrived several hours prior to the posted check-in time. Upon arrival in the room, I found that the airconditioning was not working. I called housekeeping and a repair person was in and out of the room within half an hour, and we had no further difficulties. I have never stayed anywhere with more efficient valet service. Even on weekend evenings when there are events at the hotel, I never waited more than a minute or two to take the car out. Rather than pulling up in front of the hotel, I always just drove the car down to the garage and left the key with the valet so there was never a wait at drop-off. The Westgate's style is definitely on the old-fashioned side in terms of style and furnishings. It is not in any way faded or run-down, but there are crystal chandeliers and gilt and embroidered upolsteries...think French Provincial. If modern, streamlined, less-is-more surroundings are more to your taste, then you may not like this much. Other family members (male) who also stayed there found it, while comfortable, a bit "stuffy." The hotel is not quite a luxury hotel if the Georges V is your standard. There is the little something extra that the very best hotels offer mising here, but at $179/night for three (Thurs., Fri. and Sat.) nights and $209.00 for one (Sun.) night, it felt pretty darn luxurious to me! I should mention that there is a $28/night fee for parking. But even with the parking it was cheaper than many less well appointed properties. In all honesty, it was a steal! If I had a tour of the accomodations in advance and was asked to guess the price per night, I would have guessed in the $350-$400 range. I would most definitely consider staying at the Westgage on my next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: KimmersPalmDesert
Reviews.Content: We recently visited The Westgate Hotel in San Diego, CA. I was only moderately excited about this hotel because research indicated it was older and antique"ish" in it's design and furnishings. I could not have been more pleased with our stay. It is indeed older and the furnishings are antique, but it was beautiful and clean and quiet and wonderful. The room was clean, LARGE and well appointed. The staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. The entire experience was much more than I hoped for. We actually decided to spend an entire day at the hotel, enjoying room service, in-room movies and the ambiance of the hotel and city. Room service prices were reasonable and the staff was the epitome of professionalism. I would highly recommend this hotel and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what to think...”
Reviews.Author: aiya
Reviews.Content: I recently got the Westgate after bidding on Priceline and stayed for five nights. While the hotel was quite nice to look at and the rooms clean and comfortable, I found service to be slightly lacking. I attributed it to there not being a business function and the staff being on 'autopilot'. Upon arriving we noticed no soap at all in the bathroom. The front desk promised to send some up but no one ever came by. The second day after housekeeping came and went still left us with no soap. We had to make a run to the local CVS/Rite Aid to purchase our own. Our shower drain was plugged the first night so we notified the front desk when leaving the next morning. It was mostly cleared by the time we returned that evening. The full length windows and sliding door was nice to have and the view out of our tenth floor room was better than I've had in a long time. The king size bed was more of a queen but it did its job. Another nice addition was the semi private foyer that two rooms share. It cut down on ambient hallway noise I assume since I heard nothing but our neighbor come and go. Arriving after 9:00pm means no valet, but you can leave your keys with the desk and they will drive it around the corner to the Hotel Garage. The attendants in the garage are very efficient and quite nice even though they 'lost' our car for a few minutes each time we went to pick it up. Not a big deal as they found it quite quickly. There is a 24 hour fitness center and they supply a cooler of fruit infused ice water. Plenty of towels are available as well as headsets to use. It was never crowded and seemed quite clean. We sampled room service once and wasn't overly impressed but found nothing wrong with it either. The bread basket had a great selection though. Like the title states, I'm not sure what to think. The place was nice enough and we got a great deal through Priceline. At that rate I wouldn't mind staying here again. At the rack rate? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with in the middle of dwon twon”
Reviews.Author: Fremont_Dude
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice surprise. I did not know what to expect, since i have not heard of it before. It has Excellent room with nice marble bath rooms. Room is quite roomy :-) for a family. Nice downtwon location means, no need to take your car out and just walk to all nice things in downtwon. be ready to pay $28 per day for valet parking. But this is almost given. Every thing in the room is quite clean and nice. Had good complementary starbucks coffee in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: glenysTucson
Reviews.Content: The room was immaculate and the staff was friendly. I especially liked the valets in the garage for being the most efficient in town. The location was centeral to so many sightseeing spots.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem... What a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: Surfergirle
Reviews.Content: I named my price for downtown San Diego on Priceline for $80 a night, for a half business half romantic stay. I was shocked whern I saw that I had been given the Westgate. I am in the Wedding industry and I have worked there many times but have yet to stay there. I had called earlier in the week to confirm my room and request a non smoking room with a bath tub. I spoke with Mrs. Markova and she was a delight. She informed me all of the rooms were non smoking. Upon arrival at 9 pm on June 1, we were greeted and told that we had been upgraded to a room with a bath tub. I was very happy as when I am vacationing I love to take baths. Upon arrival to the room I was very impressed with the high end decor and all marble bathroom. The room was spacious and elegant. I slept very well that night and my only complaint was the bad reception on the television. I shouldnt have been watching TV anyhow, I had to be up at 5. Our Next night there, June 2nd was great. the Westgate is right next to Horton Plaza, and within walking distance of all the Gaslamp Quarter. We walked everywhere. There were a lot of couples like us about as well as many business people. The downtown area is home to many homeless, but I was very happy to see homeless assistance squads interacting with them. It was not like they were forgotten by the city. This really impressed me. I have traveled a lot and have never seen this much assistance in action. That night we stopped by the bar at the Westgate during the happy hour and I got a wonderful Kir Royale for $7. The service was friendly and professional. Every time we passed by the front desk we were greeted with our name, with the staff had went out of the way to remember it. That night we ate at about 10:40 PM in the bar from the restaurants menu. I ordered the tortilla soup and my husband ordered the prawns. It was presented well and had the great flavor. Again, great service. That night the television had perfect reception. maybe it was a sign that I should have not been watching so late the night before. ;) Our sheets were lovely, and overall I would love to go back. Since we were leaving for a cruise, we were treated to a 2 PM checkout and we had the perfect amount of time to go eat and pack. Overall I would say that this is one of my most favorite places, and I have stayed at the St. Regis and The Ritz Carlton. I wish I would have had time to enjoy their award winning brunch or have High Tea there. Lastly, the overall design of this location is Palatial to say the least, and the Ballroom is the most beautiful in all of the Southland, and is named Versailles, and I would definitely say that name is fitting The only thing thi hotel is missing is a pool, but it is more than made up for in many other ways. I am very picky and give this hotel a solid 4.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but trouble with billing”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastersinOnt
Reviews.Content: The Westgate was a very nice hotel and we were happy with the location and ammenities. Although we stayed closer to the water for the initial part of our visit and liked that better (even though the hotel wasn't as nice). We booked through Priceline and got a room $100 per night. The parking is expensive $28 for valet and there is really no alternative if you have a car. We ended up paying cash for the remainder of our bill on check-out - which was supposed to be for parking only. Since it was early when we checked out I didn't catch that they actually billed me for 4 days of parking instead of the 3 that we stayed. Plus they charged me over $8 for a toll-free number call (to reach our car rental facility) saying that it was long distance. When I tried to explain to the desk attendant they told me to call accounting when I returned home and they would refund the charge (which they now will not credit my card since I paid cash). And I found through my online banking that they charged me for another $28 parking which I didn't even sign. They did agree to refund me the 2 extra days of parking - we'll see how that goes. The free-high speed internet was a bonus but it was very slow. Overall the hotel is nice and close to Gaslamp District but if you're going to California for the beaches, stay closer to the water! I likely won't return just because of the hassle with the billing.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good ...”
Reviews.Author: aussienorules
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown San Diego but sadly the wireless and fixed wire access had been done all day. The staff particularly Niklas ---- who claims to be a Director of Operations decided that my temerity for asking when it might be fixed meant he could be as rude as he liked. Our shower was plugged up and we had to wait 30 minutes for it to be fixed before we could return to the room. In general staff seem to be pleasant if a little short and mostly from countries where English is not the primary language so if that is something you look for then don't come here. Also, phone lines are next to impossible to hear anyone on so make sure you pack your cell phone. For families please note that there is no swimming pool at this location. I put value as high as I paid only PRICELINE prices for this property = $80 vs. the $200+ rack rate which would have made this a place I would not soon have forgotten for all of the wrong reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaEle
Reviews.Content: I recently went to San Diego for my friends wedding at The Westgate and it was truly a memorable experience...from the incredible palatial decor, to the great attention from the staff we received..my husband and I enjoyed our time at the hotel. Our room was really comfortable...and the shower the best! The Wedding was so nice..it was in a beautiful ballroom with enormous chandelieres. I recommend the restaurant...service and quality of food was great and reasonable prices. We had breakfast and the french toast is to die for. (very unique presentation) The staff is very nice, and friendly..they couldnt do more to make our stay wonderful. We felt special, and would definitely return. It is a unique place..you feel like you are in Europe and I highly recommend it as one of the best hotels for service, comfort and food.

Reviews.Title: “Westgate Hotel - Beautiful. Outstanding Service. Great Food.”
Reviews.Author: haraslynnyl
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Westgate Hotel reminds me of my European vacations. Trust me – if you haven’t had European service, you cannot judge outstanding service – where being a waiter is a career worth doing well, not a job you have during college because you can make good tips but if you get fired, no worries, you’ll get another job. That is the difference and it seems the Westgate hotel recognizes this, and perhaps that is why they have an international staff. After valeting our car, when we arrived at the front desk, it was obvious the valet corresponded with the front desk as they called us by our name before my husband told them who we were. When we checked in, the clerk told us where the opera house was and told us about the pre-opera dinner at the hotel. This would normally not sound important but it means that when I booked our reservation, the call operator took a note of why we were visiting – to go to the opera and stay downtown afterwards. A note that the front desk clerk read and made mention of during our check in. She also asked us if she could walk us to our room, another simple service not frequently found in the US, except at the best hotels. While we don’t need someone to take us to our room, it was a nice gesture. The room was beautiful, and the marble bathroom compliments the antique decor. I mention this because sometimes in hotels or bed and breakfasts that use antique decoration, cleanliness sometimes suffers but this is not the case at the Westgate. It was very clean. The food was, by far, my favorite part. We decided we will make the trip again just for dining. Again, service was five star and the food was perfect. While I like trying different things, my husband was so impressed with the food that we had breakfast there in the morning. I learned the difference between homemade juice and fresh juice. The homemade juice is spectacular and unique. I look forward to staying longer next time and hopefully staying over the weekend to try their Sunday brunch.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok... Just Ok.”
Reviews.Author: s2kbunny
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego for a friend's wedding and didnt want to drive all the way back home too late since we had our daughter with us. We Pricelined the Hotel and won our bid at $70.00/ night. The rooms are just ok. The decor is a bit outdated. No flat panel TV. The chair upholstery is old. The carpet looked like it had a flood in the room and was severely discolored. I had to see if it was just discolored or really wet because it looked wet. It was dry but I think it was overly shampoo'd because my feet were a bit sticky from walking on it. The bathrooms are nice with marble but the grout is dirty. Caution! The tub is very slippery. It has those non slip strips on it but it is still very slick. There is a step out balcony which was nice. Wouldnt leave it open if you have a child there. The A/C Heater is not very functional, the room was always too hot or too cold. One thing we found weird was there is a hallway door to get to your room door and the room door is not marked once you get though the 1st door. It's a nice feature since you don't have to hear people walking up and down the halls outside your door and adds a bit more security but I think they should mark the actual rooms a better. We stayed on the 6th floor. There is a lot of noise from the street. But hey, you can't beat being right in the middle of the city. With that.... parking is expensive $28.00 a night! All Valet service. One thing, their site does mention there are pateries and coffee in the lobby but I did not find this ammenity.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4qqqq
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. I would highly recommend. It is centrally located to the Gaslamp district and to the mall. Everything we did was in walking distance. It has an old feel to it, but I guess it's really not that old. The molding on the ceilings were very pretty as well as the antiques. I loved the shower stall. It was square shaped and it made it feel so roomy. Had a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: TexasSharvi
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel! It starts at the front desk- superb staff, willing to assist you in any way. The rooms are delightful- large, clean, just beautiful. The location is right in the middle of everything. You can walk to the water, to many restaurants, bars, shopping. I'd recommend this hotel to family and friends in a heartbeat. If you're visiting San Diego and need a hotel- give this one a try.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhillyVoyager
Reviews.Content: I frequently seek out hotels part of the "Leading Hotels of the World" group, especially when traveling for business. What you get is a unique old world experience of wonderful service and interesting decor. It's a nice break from the standardized cookie cutter experience of big chains like the Marriotts and Hyatts. The Westgate was no exception in regard to courteous service with the staff really going out of their way to make the experience wonderful. I felt welcomed from the moment I stepped inside at 2:00 AM from a flight delay and exhausted. The lobby definitely needs some renovation and is the weakest part of the hotel. My room was large, well equipped, and with a panoramic view (I called ahead the day of my arrival and requested a room with a view). I had breakfast at the hotel each morning and I particularly commend the receptionist, wait staff, and the quality of the food. I was traveling for a conference and it was about a 20 minute walk to the convention center, but I prefer being away from the hustle bustle of conferences and the weather is almost always good in San Diego. Horton Plaza is right across the street with a myriad of dining and shopping options. The parking is expensive, but no worse than anywhere in San Diego. I'd definitely stay there again when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: PV_Fubar
Reviews.Content: The decor is a little dated. The hotel was built in the 70's could use a re-fresh. Staff is helpful and the restaurant was good. I would stay here again as long as I got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Experience...”
Reviews.Author: ockathylovesred
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westgate for our first wedding anniversary. We were greeted by a fantastically helpful staff, and had a very easy check-in. I noticed a slightly musty smell when we walked into the grand lobby, but it wasn't a big deal. The staff gave us a complimentary upgrade to a room on the 17th floor overlooking Horton Plaza, the NBC building, the bay and Coronado Bridge. BEAUTIFUL! When we got to the room, I was at first surprised by the decor. I felt as though I had stepped back in time into my grandmother's house that was still decorated in a very old school style. In defense of the hotel, the decor is supposed to be an older style. As I spent more time in the room, I realized that I actually liked the decor. It was very soothing, elegant and comfortable, and the colors were quite lovely - all except for the ridiculously hideous bed comforter. As it turned out, I was mostly bothered by that and not the rest. It was ugly and didn't properly match with the rest of the very nice decor. The room was also very large, spacious and bright. It had a very nice overall feel. Anyway, the bathroom was a nice size, but had some downfalls. First off, there was only one sink, and the vanity looked and smelled like it had been there for a little too long. It definitely needs some upgrading. Also, the sink area was carpeted. Yikes. The carpet looked clean and appeared to be in good shape, but seriously - carpet in ANY part of the bathroom is just not a good idea. Period. The shower/toilet area appeared to be old school marble, but the shower was a good size. The showerhead was far too low for my 6' husband, but was just fine for me. It was all very clean and was comfortable overall, but definitely not the Ritz or St. Regis. Some updates and changes would be good. Some other great things about the hotel stay were that the staff was always willing to call us a cab or help us with anything we needed in a very prompt manner. They also provided us with some YUMMY chocolate covered strawberries in honor of our anniversary. Overall, I was very pleased with our stay. And I have high standards and am quite picky! I would definitely stay at the Westgate again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: darkandme
Reviews.Content: We husband and I just returnted from san diego. Our stay at the Westgate was just perfect. Wonderful staff, room were very clean, great location across from the mall, lost of resturants close by, 7-11 on the corner, Longs Pharmacy across the street. We also had our 14 month old son with us the rooms were a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UtahBbauer
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Westgate Hotel and it was amazing. Close to the Marina to walk and see all the boats, walking distance to so many great restaurants, close to large outdoor mall, etc. The rooms were large and quiet. The staff was amazing. Great to be able to pull down to the parking garage and have a valet take your care and park it for you. Close to amazing beaches and Sea World only about 8 minutes away. Amazing and Highly recommend to anyone that wants to stay in downtown San Diego close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: klondike459
Reviews.Content: Arriving from the airport by hotel shuttle was quick and nice to have. The hotel charges $5 each way for shuttle service, but well worth $10 total for ground transportation (much cheaper than taxi). We arrived a little too early for check in, but the front desk secured our bags and had our cell number to notify us when the room was ready. We walked around outside in the warm California sunshine and quickly found a 7-11 very close to the hotel - nice to know a 24hr store is close by for any late night munchie attacks. My cell rang and the hotel was ready to check us in. Our bags were delivered to our room just minutes later. The hotel does not recognize a 13th floor, according to their rooms or elevator. Found that nostalgic. The room was clean and clean smelling. What a great king size bed and even better pillow selection available. The room is very spacious with a large vanity and seperate toilet and shower. The shower head seemed a bit low, I am 5' 11" and and figured the shower head was only 5' 7" high. No idea why. Large closet space for clothing. No wi-fi in the rooms, but you can plug in your ethernet cable to the outlet. If you forget your cable, like we did, you can purchase one inside your room for $8.00. Trust me, I forgot my cable and the mall across the street charged twice as much. We found wi-fi to be available in the lobby and was told there was wi-fi in the conference rooms - end of our connection problem. Each hotel staff member we encountered either in the hallway, lobby or front door were very cordial and ready to assist in answering any quesitons we had. I like to talk with hotel staff when traveling and quiz them on anything from hotel services to nearby attractions. By the way, the 4-5 story mall just across the street - very nice! During our stay we talked to about 15 different staff members and each answered our questions 100% of the time with a smile. We thought the room price was accurate for location and it's excellent service. The hotel decor was in a early French theme and matched with the rest of the hotel. Excellent Stay! Thanks Westgate!

Reviews.Title: “The Westgate is in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: MPD71
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the Westgate for my stay. The rooms are sizeable, with extremely comfortable beds. Good service, and the hotel is in a fantastic location in downtown San Diego. I walked to Petco Park for a Padres game, and there are a great many restaurants and bars in easy walking distance. If you know downtown San Diego, then you know how close it is to the airport, too.

Reviews.Title: “Timeless Boutique”
Reviews.Author: revenueguru
Reviews.Content: A friend turned me on to this timeless, classic, boutique hotel. Solid service, very large comfortable rooms, and a shower that has incredible water pressure! It's right across from Horton Plaza at the base of the Gas Lamp. We actually walked to Petco Park to see the Padres get beat by the Marlins. I check out tomorrow but I will defintely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: K F
Reviews.Content: Traveled to SD on business and stayed at the Westgate. My first and lasting impression is that the rooms are HUGE! They really are! Checked in late, but had no problems. There was an issue with my phone, but they sent someone up to fix it right away and never had another issue with it. They don't have free internet, but they have a cable you buy from the mini bar for $10 and then you're set for the duration of your stay. Better than some hotels that charge $9.95 a day. Turn down service every night, and they play soft music on your TV. Ordered room service one morning, and they were very fast and food was good. The decor has a little over-the-top Versailles feel to it, but it's not that bad. I had to laugh at one of the reviews below. The elevators ARE really slow. The foyer thing to the rooms is a little odd too, although I’ve seen it in other older hotels before. The annoying thing about the foyer setup is that you can hear the doors pretty loudly when you enter and leave your room. Luckily I had quiet neighbors. The hotel is right next to Horton Plaza, at the top of the Gaslamp. You’re a short walk from all the restaurants and bars. What you are not close to is the convention center, however, the trolley stops right behind the hotel. It runs every 15 minutes to the convention center and costs $1.25. It is by far the easiest and fastest way to get down there. Overall, it’s a nice hotel for the price. It might not be the hippest, newest hotel but it doesn’t need to be when you have all the great bars/restaurants so close in the Gaslamp. You get an enormous room and good service for the same or less than most hotels in downtown SD. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kcouture
Reviews.Content: After 4 nights at the Hotel Del at Coronado Island we moved to the Westgate on June 5th so that we could se a little of downtown and see Cats at the Civic Center. This is exactly what I had in mind. The valet unloaded our car and directed us into an elegant lobby. We were early for check in (only 1:00) but we walked up to the desk and were treated kindly and immediately. Our questions were answered and we were given our keys. They have keys here not those plastic cards. We we got to the 14th floor, we were met minutes later by the bell who unloaded our bags. We left a short while later to walk across the street to the Horton plaza to do some shopping. Upon our return a few hours later the bell returned with a box made of chocolate containing truffles and a bottle of sparkling lemonade with a card wishing us a nice night out. The beds were nice and a full wall of windows looked out on the NBC building and downtown. In the distance we could see the bridge and ocean on the horizon. That night we walked to the civic center which was just on the other side of the hotel. We also did some late night adventuring on the gaslamp. It was a bit brash outside but very nice to be able to walk home. Overall perfect location downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: hopegreaux
Reviews.Content: I went to the Westgate for 2 days in February for business. The room was very comfortable and the whole property very elegant. It was pretty easy walking distance to the water and to the Gaslamp district. The only problem I had is that the outlet in the dressing area was not working and it was difficult blowdrying my hair next to the tv!

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed how quiet the hotel was. The service was first class; they even brought strawberries and lemonade, free of charge. The lobby was very elegant. The only objection is that parking costs $27/night, which seemed excessive. Having said that we definately would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodations and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: SophieArizona
Reviews.Content: Having just recently returned from a business trip in San Diego, I felt compelled to send in my review of The Westgate Hotel and my fabulous experience. The rooms were beyond my expections in comfort and decor, meals and service excellent and, to top all of this, the Bell Captain, Sergio, went above and beyond in providing service. Specifically, after the taxi called for us left us at the curb, Sergio directed us into the shuttle and personally drove my co-worker and me to the airport. We were totally impressed with his attitude and service and he is definitely an asset to your establishment.

Reviews.Title: “A great gem in downtown San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Sailguy
Reviews.Content: I joined my wife who was there for 2-days worth of work meetings and we had a great time! Pleasant experience from the moment we entered their lobby and checked in until the moment we left. The word elegant has been noted in several of the reviews and that is just what you'll experience. If you are looking for a chain property that is cookie cutter or cutting edge this isn't for you. Yes, some of the fixtures look a little worn and, no, they don't have flat screen TVs, but with everything else going for them we didn't miss those items a bit. Old world charm abounds from the lobby's ornate marble, amazing wood work, furniture and fixtures through to its unusually large-sized rooms that you just don't see anymore in the chain properties. Marble in the bathrooms, glass doors on the showers and a huge king bed made this a great experience. I'm a stickler for the staff/customer service component and this was a memorable experience in that regard too. Everyone greeted us pleasantly and even looked us in the eye whenever we came upon them in the lobby, elevators, front desk, etc. They actually held the front doors and elevators for us. You just don't see that anymore. Only hitch, my wife needed Internet access and due to a problem with their SBC connection she couldn't use her laptop for the Web. We ended up in the business center where a wonderfully friendly staff person, Linda, let us use one of the desktop PCs without cost and continued to push the property's IT dept. to fix the problem for us which they did. The lower concourse has the gift shop/business center, gym and parking. Gym was nice-sized and quiet so no trouble for me getting time on the equipment. We didn't have a chance to try the bar or restaurant, but would definitely do so on our next trip. The hotel caters to high-end receptions and has a great roof-top deck with fountains that our room overlooked. As for the hotel's location, it's right downtown so great to venture out and see the sights. Ample fast food around and a huge mall, Horton Plaza, just across the street with a great food court, movie theatre and tons of shopping. Just a 10-15 minute walk down Broadway in front of the hotel to the harbor and all its atractions. Would definitely go back - highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: alouisemcg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when i managed a conference for one of my clients. I found it to be truly on par with many luxury european hotels i have visited. The decor throughout the hotel is decadent, and the rooms are reasonably sized and well planned. I had the pleasure of working with the entire staff, who were for the most part very accomodating. Gabor (banquets) and Shraddha (concierge), were extremely knowledgable and went out of their way for myself, my colleagues and our clients. The catering director, whose name i have regrettably and embarrassingly misplaced, was just as excellent. The sales staff, however, left something to be desired. Though personable enough, they did not seem to be very experienced in hosting a large event. The hotel restaurants are fantastic, serving upscale California fare, and room service was impeccable. The location is not a great one for the tourist, as it is in the business district of the city. I was able to find some excellent restaurants and nightclubs nearby, though. And it was not a far walk from the trains, trams, buses, or ocean! On the whole, my company and our clients were very pleased with the event and our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, but not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: love2traveltheworld
Reviews.Content: To celebrate my fiancé’s birthday we decided on a weekend getaway to San Diego. I booked a hotel through Hotwire, based on star rating and location in the Gaslamp quarter, and was pleased to find out we were staying at The Westgate. Despite a bland outside appearance, the interior architecture and decor of The Westgate has a European, and distinctly French, charm. The location to Horton Plaza and the restaurants/shops of the Gaslamp Quarter is certainly one of the main attractions to this hotel. (We even walked about 15 minutes to Petco Park for a baseball game). During check-in, we found the desk staff friendly and helpful. They upgraded us to a room on a higher floor. I was initially excited, but disappointed to step inside and have the NBC building directly across the street blocking much of the harbor view. The room itself was comfortable. Our bed was plush, with soft down pillows and a comforter. Two nightstands with marble tops were adjacent to the bed. In front of the sliding glass door to the balcony was a leather-topped work desk with complimentary Internet access. (Wireless is only available in the restaurant and bar). Also in the room were a chair and ottoman, television, DVD player, minibar, and phone with 2 separate lines. A bucket of ice was left during turn down service and a morning newspaper was delivered. The bathroom contained a vanity and an over-sized square-shaped marble shower/bathtub. ***The sides of the tub were very high and may not be suitable for those who have difficulty climbing in and out of a tub.*** Gilchrist & Soames toiletries were available as well as a hairdryer, two robes, an ironing board/iron and a vanity. The bathroom, although clean, felt run-down. The hotel really should repair the peeling wallpaper and consider better lighting. Valet service was quick, but the $24/night garage fee was ridiculously high, esp. for a hotel of this caliber. The other drawback to The Westgate is the traffic noise. Despite being in a room almost to the top of the hotel, the traffic noise on the street below was constant. With the many hotels in San Diego, I'll probably try elsewhere during my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Westgate Hotel, SanDiego”
Reviews.Author: Dmcbhoover
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay at this charming hotel, Great staff, lovely large but cozy rooms. Very convient to downtown activities. Close to the Civic Center, and many fine restaurants and activities. We were there 5 days and enjoyed every minute of our stay. The Concierge was very helpful in directing us to activities that fit our style and time. There was a shuttle service to and from the airport. Also got a free ride to the Harbour to go on a tour. There was no coffee pot in the room, but there was a small room set up off of the lobby with coffee and tea for guests every morning. Also had breakfast at the hotel one morning and it was reasonable and enjoyable. We found St.Tropiz restaurant just a block away. This was even better for breakfast or lunch. A little French Bistro in the heart of the city. Horton Plaza was a block away with great shopping and activity. Gaslamp was within walking distance, and for longer runs the Trolly stop was just behind the hotel. There was a 3rd floor veranda where you could sit and enjoy the city. The entire staff was friendly and accommodating to us from the get go. We look forward to staying there again. Dmcbhoover, Indianapolis, IN

Reviews.Title: “One Of The Best In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: sasmd3
Reviews.Content: Over the years we have visited this hotel at least 10 times. The guest rooms, the public rooms, the restaurants are superbly furnished and decorated. Beautiful pieces of furniture everywhere. Quality Persian Rugs on shining wood floors. The personel are friendly, helpful, and forthcoming. They are moslty young western European men and women who seem interested in your comfort. The guest rooms are spacious. Each room has a good TV and DVD/CD player. The plumbing is efficient. Quiet is the rule. mattresses are firm and comfortable. The exercise room is well equipped. The garage is handy and the attendants are helpful. Location is perfect. Across the street from Horton Plaza and 5 minutes from Balboa Park and all of its attractions. The restaurants in the hotel are first class; and there are dozens of top restaurants within walking distance. I am not associated with the hotel; I just think it is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Elegantly decorated, professional courteous staff, the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: BonnieNJ
Reviews.Content: A copy of a letter we just sent to the hotel: My husband and I recently stayed at your hotel. We were there on Monday and Tuesday nights, September 3rd and 4th. I am writing to tell you that our stay with you was the most pleasant we have ever had at a hotel. When we were first greeted we were told by the very lovely young woman at the front desk that we were upgraded to an upper floor (our room was 1689 I believe). When we saw the room we were floored! It was so elegantly decorated - with a beautiful bath and dressing area - and very roomy. The rooms were very quiet and the beds extremely comfortable. The maid responded very quickly to a request for a few additional pillows. As soon as we were settled in we had drinks at one of your bars - and - again - were greeted and served by a very sweet but professional young woman. We felt totally comfortable and decided right then and there that if we could have we WOULD have booked an extra day or two. We were thinking about going out for dinner - but opted on having dinner at your restaurant (the cafe) because the menu did look very good. The wait staff was great and so was the food. Breakfast the next day was also a delight. People say that your hotel room is not a big deal because you don't spend all day in your room. You are out sight-seeing most of the time. This is not true for us. Even though we spent the entire day at the zoo - and also visited Coronado in the short time we were in San Diego, the hotel and the hotel room are VERY important to us. The hotel can make or break your vacation time. Again - from the bell man who took our bags to our room to the young man who retrieved our car for us on the morning we left, we were treated with extraordinary courtesy. We will probably not be back to San Diego - but I almost feel like visiting the city again JUST to stay at the Westgate. Thank you once again for the wonderful two days we spent with you. Bonnie and James

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: oasisheikh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our honeymoon for 4-5 days, and chose the hotel due to its location and relatively good price for a 5-star hotel. However, upon our arrival, we were quite underwhelmed. Although some people might have liked the room decorations, we thought the hotel seemed quite antiquated. Also, the room service menu did not have much variety, and our meals were late a couple of times. The staff was not as friendly as we could of liked, as there were a couple of times we called the concierge for requests and got very delayed responses, if we got responses at all. Once, we asked for headache medicine, and when it finally arrived (30 minutes later), we later found out that they charged us for it. I would have been better off going to the local pharmacy! We also felt rushed by the hotel to check out by receiving numerous calls. The best thing about the hotel was the location, as it was convenient to many of the local sites in San Diego, and very close to one of the main shopping centers. Overall, we were quite disappointed in the hotel, and probably would not stay again. If you enjoy the retro atmosphere, it may be ok, otherwise, we would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect hotel in the center of san diego”
Reviews.Author: usreisen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just perfect: very competent and nice people at the reception, always very helpful and extremely friendly, great breakfast, beautiful rooms and wonderful decoration in the entrance hall. The hotel is very central and is a great place to discover San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: yikes1
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at the Westgate with my wife and two teenage boys. The first thing you notice as you enter the lobby is how tastefully it's decorated. It is a very classy look. The room was very spacious although queen sized beds would have been a little more comfortable than the " oversized doubles ". I advise you to stay as high up as possible as the view of the downtown is spectacular and the traffic can get a little noisy. The hotel offers a very convenient shuttle service to and from the airport and to attractions like the zoo and seaworld. The location is close to the Gaslamp district, Horton Plaza and is adjacent to the train system. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen Property at the Westage Beware”
Reviews.Author: Netranger808
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Westgate Hotel. The entire area of the hotel and its double door entry way was impressive (security). My bedroom overlooked the Skyline of San Diego, which was just beautiful. However, my Chargers back pack was stolen out of my room. There was only one person who could have taken the backpack and that was the maid. Now ask yourself one many simple questions. 1. If the remote control to the television set was placed at the foot of the bed before we went shopping. Why on earth was it at the head of the bed on the floor where it could not be reached. I had to forcibly place my arm between the bed and floor to retrieve it. 2. Why did the maid know where the remote was on the floor at the foot of the bed. Answer: My Chargers backpack was in the vicinity. 3. Most travelers know, when a remote control is found by the maid in the room. They place it back on the entertainment center, not the head of the bed on the floor. 4. The investigation by Law Enforcement standards was weak. The fact that they (management) were more concerned about not being liable than locating my backpack was really disappointing. In all my medication, camera, jewelry, passport, address book and other miscellaneous items were taken without consent. No question in my mind the Hotel is beautiful and quaint. However, the lack of cameras in the hall way. The double doors leading into the rooms shield any wrong doing by its workers. You are suspect to being ripped off and management won’t care. I am pretty sure I am not the only person to stay at the Westgate Hotel to be ripped off. However, being a native of San Diego and being ripped off by a green card holder or illegal alien really ticked me off. Therefore I suggest you stay elsewhere. Make sure you lock all your baggage away before you leave your room. Good Luck . . .

Reviews.Title: “Westgate is a gem...”
Reviews.Author: coasttocoast2
Reviews.Content: Great experience! I booked a room at the Westgate at the last minute for a July 4th overnight. We arrived, dressed *very* casually, in their elegant lobby, and were treated well anyway. Concierge was most helpful in identifying spots to view fireworks. Room was lovely, great view, no traffic noise. Parking valets were efficient and polite, and we took the car out several times during our short stay. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: 5starfan
Reviews.Content: I loved the Westgate hotel and thank you to San Diego expert who posted a reply and advised me about the Westgate when I was looking for a hotel in San Diego. The Sunday brunch was one of the best I have ever encountered on my travels. Staff were helpful although the doormen were a little dour. I would throughly recommend the Westgate Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Did not stay again”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerNyc
Reviews.Content: The Westgate is a lovely hotel no doubt about that. It has wonderful decorations throughout the hotel. My room had me feeling like royality. It is an upper class, elegant hotel. My problem w/ the hotel was when I arrived the parking was full and no one tried to help me w/ parking my car. I was told to park it on the street but get up early to move it by 6:00am or drive around and see what you can find. This was at 12:00am and I am a female, in downtown, in a not so nice area! I tried to explain, but got the "thats your problem" attitude. Thank goodness I have a brain and ended up going to a close hotel asking to park in their garage. On the way walking back two men started CHASING me I ran into the hotel and told them and they started to laugh and did nothing. I come to San Diego yearly for business, this year I stayed at the Sheraton and had a much better exprience. It is not all glitzy as Westgate, but it is SAFE and that is whats most important! This hotel is in a bad area and they do not even try to help their guests, shame on you Westgate!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay, But Noisy.”
Reviews.Author: JabaGee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westgate for 3 nights on a conference rate. Overall, very positive stay. This is an elegant hotel, and if you like the sophisticated European style (website pics are accurate), you will be happy here. In hindsight, we realize the modern vibe at some of the other downtown hotels is a better fit for us (we're in our 30s). The Good: Very nice, clean, spacious rooms; great beds; lovely welcome tray (chocolate truffles!); small balcony (see below); good bathroom amenities; strong water pressure; eager turn-down service. Rooms are set away from hallway by a door, so hallway noise is minimal. Had a decent bay view. Great location; Horton plaza is right there, quick walk to Gaslamp and other great restaurants. A few blocks from convention center, easily walkable. Free airport shuttle. The bellman (Sergio) was super-helpful. The Not-So-Good: While no hotel is perfect, the small annoyances at the Westgate would have been more bothersome had we been paying the full rate (often more than $400). Downtown San Diego is loud & our balcony doors did not lock! We heard lots of street noise by 6AM and were kept up by an outside hotel party into wee hours of morning, despite being on 11th floor. Small gym is fine, but hotel was fully booked, so the 5 cardio machines were not enough. Our towels and robe were not replenished one day. Desk staff was very polite, but not particularly effective. The gilded lobby is small, with most of the space going to an area of tables where afternoon tea is served. Lastly, we were charged for something from minibar we didn't use (they said they'd reverse the charge). For one night of our reservations, they charged us a few dollars more than quoted. It was only $6, so we didn't care & didn't mention it. But, combined with the last-minute minibar charge, we were left with a bit of a bad taste in our mouths. Detailed annoyances aside, we would recommend this hotel. We had a nice stay overall and think the pros definitely outweigh the cons.

Reviews.Title: “Old-Fashioned, Gracious Elegance”
Reviews.Author: ptlomagirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first two nights of our honeymoon, and we had an amazing time. We had a fabulous room near the top floor (maybe two or three floors from the top) with gorgeous views. The room was beautiful and tasteful and a comfortable size. The bathroom was very nice, although the shower was on the small size (although comfortable for one person). We ate dinner at the grill and at the Le Fountainbleu, and both nights, the food was amazing. The grill's food was just as good as the Le Fountainbleu, but it was completely empty. We had excellent service from the waiter, but it was odd to be the only ones there (not that we minded :). The first morning we came back to the room and there was champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries; the next morning, sparkling lemonade and chocolates. Overall, quite worth the stay; the location is excellent, in the middle of everything (a car isn't necessary), and the staff was wonderful. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Underrated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kaisanlahti
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at the Westgate Hotel and was concerned before arriving by some of the comments made by some reviewers. In my experience, I do not consider that full justice has been done to the quality of this hotel. I found the hotel's staff was polite and friendly and willing to help when asked. I did not encounter any of the frostiness felt by other reviewers. The hotel is very well situated downtown for shops, sightseeing etc and it has a relaxed, comfortable ambiance. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others. I also stayed at a similar standard hotel in San Diego near the convention center, which I would not recommend however. If you are looking for a comfortable place to stay,. choose the Westgate.

Reviews.Title: “Snobbish Westgate Falls Short”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Kim
Reviews.Content: I had no problem with the hotel or the room itself. From the outside and the lobby, the hotel looks quite classy, but the rooms are merely average to nice. The problem that I had was with the snobby staff! After dealing with several people who seemed to care less that I was spending money at their hotel, the kicker came when I parked in front of the hotel. The Westgate is on a small street, without a lot of through traffic. I had parked on the curb to allow my friend to take our shopping bags up to our room. An employee in charge of driving the hotel shuttle rudely asked me to move my car (it was all about the tone of voice) so that he could park his there. The entire curb was available, but he just HAD to have my parking spot. I was over it. I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and close to entertainment”
Reviews.Author: t19p5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westgate for the weekend after conference at Hyatt Manchester. Westgate is a very nice hotel in the middle of downtown. We stayed on the 5th floor facing a parking garage across the street, so the view wasn't much to write about. The trolley runs behind the hotel but it's pretty quiet. THe lobby is very victorian (gilded chairs with flowery fabric) with free wi-fi. There is a open deck on the 3rd floor with chaises, chairs and tables. We spent one afternoon enjoying the fresh air and reading. The room was spacious, nicely decorated and clean. The bed was comfortable with nice sheets and down comforter. Housekeeping did a great job with the room. The room has a weak wi-fi signal and you'll need a cord to get a good connection. The hotel is close to Gaslamp and clubs - everything is within short walking distance, so car is not necessary. Hotel has free shuttle to/from airport but a cab is only $10. The city is very clean. The public transportation is admirable. But there are quite a few homeless people in downtown. They are harmless but stinky. The amusing part is that they like to sleep by the police headquarters across from Westgate. This little ditty would never work in NYC. Overall, I picked this hotel because of location and atmosphere and wasn't disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler27
Reviews.Content: Won this hotel through a Luxurylink auction and were very happy with our stay. Our package included a harbor view room, one breakfast in bed, and one dinner at Le Fountainbleu, the hotel's 5* restaurant for a four night stay. While we enjoyed our bay view room we would not pay standard rates (approx. $395) for the lodging. Since the hotel is located a bit away from the bay there were a lot of downtown buildings that obstructed our view. From our room #1695 we had views from 12 to one o'clock and 10 to 11 o'clock. If you stepped on the balcony (no seating, just a small space to area out) you had better views from 8 o'clock 11 o'clock partially obstructed by buildings. I agree that the hotel could use a coffee/tea maker but that is our only other mild negative about the hotel. We enjoyed breakfast both in our room and at the Cafe Westgate. Prices were surprisingly decent and the fruit was very fresh and tasty with hot Tazo teas. On our final evening we enjoyed dinner at Le Fountainbleu and it was delicious on Saturday night there is live music and dancing for entertainment. My spouse's dover sole was terrific, it was so hefty and seasoned well. For dessert we enjoyed selections of the creme brule, also delicious. The overall decor is old world with a French European flare. Lovely use of hard wood and pink and other bright and uplifting colors. The night assistand manager took very good care of us and allowed me to stay in the room a bit after check out while my husband had attended a Chargers game. Later that afternoon I went to the spa and had a very nice hand and foot massage, the prices were also more reasonable than expected in a downtown city hotel. All of the staff was cordial and very friendly. We did not end up using the car for 3 of our 5 days of our stay. You can catch a hop on/hop off tour bus a block away and there is a shuttle to take you to a few attractions and the airport. It is not a must to have a car while staying at the property, especially when parking overnight is $22. The room was extremely spacious and loved the floor to ceiling windows and a small balcony whose doors you can open for fresh air. The bath products were English and scented. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Very_impressed
Reviews.Content: The Westgate is perfect in every respect. The location, the decor, the staff, the food ..... Great rooms, clean, spacious and beautiful. The staff are very attentive and make everyone feel special. We cancelled the next hotel on our tour because we wanted to stay longer. Only an idiot would criticise the Westgate.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a let down and also needs coffee machine in room”
Reviews.Author: sunbeam64
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on the second part of our stay in San Diego. I should point out our first hotel was very overrated and expensive and the stay was unsatisfactory. We decided on this one in a hurry - and based our decision largely upon the reviews we read on this site. We arrived shortly after 12 noon and were immediately able to check into our room. It was clean and and roomy and looked exactly as the pictures on the website. At check in there was an emphasis on eating facilities throughout the hotel. We found the bed to be comfortable and the bathrobes were plush and a bonus (not provided at the first hotel). There was more than enough room in the dressing room. Decor was tasteful and traditional (almost renaissance style). Our room way at the rear of the hotel overlooking the trolley lines and initially we were a little concerned as we had stayed near the rail lines in the other hotel and it was horribly noisy. However, we found we never heard the trolley at all - it was actually quite peaceful - apart from hearing our neighbour open and close his door without consideration for others. The light in the shared foyer between rooms also kept us awake the first night - but we thought outside the square and made sure we turned it off when we went to bed the following nights. The hotel had advised of a function on one of the nights and indicated the elevators may be slower than normal between certain hours - the music for the event could be heard and it was horrible - however the function ended when the hotel said it would. The hotel offers a shuttle from to and from Balboa Park and Sea World at specified times - we used this and it was very convenient and puntual - as was the complementary shuttle to the airport. At check out the desk attendant could have been a little warmer - she was very effiecient but almost cold in manner - we considered this to be European efficiency - as indicated by her accent. She said we had mini bar charges - we did not use the minibar at all. She was very brusque! The conceirge was useless and was very confused about how and where to get to places. The one we dealt with spent time checking her text messages whilst tearing off a map and passing it to us - yet we had suitable maps and simply wanted to ask questions. We thought this was dreadful - a concierge should know virtually everything about a city and be willing to assist! Our biggest criticism regarded a package we were expecting. At checkin we informed the desk that this was expected. We double checked on the last business day of the week and were told this had not arrived - we had already been at the hotel for 2 days. We followed this up with a phonecall to the relevant company which had closed for the weekend. We were then travelling on to San Francisco on the Sunday. As a result we had to make repeated additional follow up calls to the business and to the hotel to find out where the package was. This is where the hotel lets itself down very badly! The package was received and signed for by a hotel employee prior to our checkout. We were told that the package was misaddressed and had the last letter on our surname missing so they assumed we were not guests. We asked that they forward it to us at our San Francisco hotel and were told we needed to call UPS ourselves. Instead we contacted the dental company and asked they sort the problem. When the package finally arrived in SF we checked the address label and whilst on one side the last letter of our surname was left off, our name was complete with hotel details on the flip side of the parcel. We feel this showed a clear lack of initiative and effort on the hotel side, particularly when we had said we were expecting the package. This cost a considerable amount of vacation time as well as money in long distance calls sorting out something that we should not have had to ourselves. This hotel also needs a coffee machine in the room - it wouldn't cost much to set each room up with one, especially when the coffee shop next door closes early and is not open at all at weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Sumptuous (but Expensive)”
Reviews.Author: wagnersh
Reviews.Content: The Westgate Hotel in San Diego is everything its website says it is, and more! It is classy, elegant, service is impeccable and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. The location (across from Horton Plaza and within a block of the north end of the Gaslamp Quarter) is perfect. The only drawbacks I found to my stay were how expensive all of the restaurants in the hotel were (even a light, late-evening snack will set you back $20-$25) and their "high-speed internet" was not wi-fi, but an ethernet line in every room. Had I known this in advance I could have brought my connector cord with me and saved the $10 on the ethernet cable available in the mini-bar. All in all, though, it was a truly great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: wildcatgary
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place. Not perfect but wonderful. Not new but very elegant. Service effort was spotless. Everyone did everything they could to make you feel like a true guest. I never touched my luggage once I got in the limo / van from the airport. Room service brought the biggest bucket of ice you have ever seen. In 20 mins. Everything took 20 mins. Picked up at airport, 20 mins. Ice, 20 mins, luggage to room, 20 mins. Wait for ride to airport, 20 mins. That's the only down side. Accept check in and out was instant. The view and room are perfect. Plenty of room. Yes a little noisey, but your downtown. Stayed facing north, 17 floor. paid about 190 on expedia. Slept with balcony doors open and heard the usuualy downtown noice. No problem sleeping. I WOULD stay again. Location is the excellent for walking to dinner out and a evening in gaslamp. Best bang for the buck downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After switching rooms four times, first-no king size bed, second-t.v. not working properly, third-traffic on Broadway too loud, fourth-18th floor facing third street, awesome room. Fourtunantly my husband and I have a sense of humor. Large rooms, beautiful decor, marble counter tops, marble shower and great water pressure. Turn down service at night which was awesome! Shuttle service to and from the airport, zoo and Seaworld. We were lucky to even get one of the bellman to take us down to gaslamp district one night on his reccomendation to Taka. Good food. (Japanesse) Location is terrific. Close to trolley which can take you to old town. The bus is close also, we took it to Balboa Park to the museums one day. When at Balboa Park, eat at the Prado Restaurant. Awesome food and price is just right. The Westgate Cafe was elegant and perfect. Ate there two times for breakfast and once for dinner-one word, deliicious! For all of you ladies, go to tea which is served in the hotel lobby from 2:30pm-5pm. Fun, fun! The hotel is decorated so elegantly, but far from stuffy. The staff all make you feel at ease. Hope you enjoy your stay! We did, and plan to go back for a family trip with our daughter.

HotelInfo.Name: The Westgate Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1055 Second Ave, San Diego, CA 92101
